loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en: Bintihamisi appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income whick she used in her saloon business.  She would like to apply for a loan of ksh.45,000 to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, hampoos and hair conditioners

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, three of them are in school. She has no additional family members. She operates a bar at the market and sells on a wholesale and retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She gets additional income from selling piped water. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of  2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy jerry cans of local gin, crates of beer, soda, and local brew. Her major business challenges are defaulters, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and to only sell wholesale. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more jerry cans of local gin, crates of beer, soda and local brew.

loans.name: Jaria

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 29-year-old Jaria from Port Loko Northern area. She is married with one child, aged 2 years. She is a housewife. She started this business to contribute in taking care of the home. 

Jaria runs general stock items at her house.  She sells cigarettes, milk, pure water, soap and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business after her wedding in 2005. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night.  Jaria says that at present she is faced with insufficient capital to expand her business. Jaria has requested a loan in order to buy more pure water, cooking seasonings and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to buy a plot of land. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more pure water, cooking seasonings and drinks.

loans.name: Famata

texts.en: Famata is 39 years old and lives around the Airport community. She is single and has six children between 7 and 18 years old. For the past eight years, she has been selling red oil, rice, oranges, etc. She started this business with credit from her mother. She likes her business because the profit she can receive every time. She is requesting a loan to purchase red oil, rice, oranges, etc., for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase red oil, rice, oranges, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 52-year-old vigorous married lady and a mother of three. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors. It will help her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en: Bilqees is a 23-year-old married woman. She has been running a business buying and selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices, near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. In order to improve her business, she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good loan history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 36-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of selling milk for the past 10 years. She has five cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. 

It is her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. She has some past savings and applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase one more cow. She is hopeful to get an increase in her earnings through her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her ninth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 20-year-old married man who has been working in the agriculture business for five years. Hassan started working early, he was only fifteen years old, to help his parents make a living.

Today he owns a tractor, which he uses to plow his land and other things, in addition to irrigating most of the land in his village. He also distributes water to the houses of people who live in his village, because most of the time they lack water. 

Hassan applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to continue building his house, in addition to buying and  pasting tiles.
This will be Hassan's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan helped a lot in doing necessary maintenance to his tractor.

Today his loan will be invested in doing the necessary maintenance to his dream house, which he will keep on fixing, building, and expanding as much as he can.

In the future, Hassan hopes to keep on expanding both businesses as much as he can, in addition to developing his family's social and financial situations.

loans.use: To continue building his house, in addition to buying and pasting tiles

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 35 years old and married.  She runs a small general store in her community, which she has been doing for many years with the support of her husband.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Sajida earns enough to provide for her family. 

Sajida is requesting a loan for 30,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates and make her store fully stocked. With this loan, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Suria

texts.en: Suria is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of furniture making with the support of her husband. She has been doing it for many years. Over time she has become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community. She is a responsible mother of eight children and is responsible for providing them with the basic necessities of life. In order to purchase good quality wood with packs of polish and nails in larger quantity, she applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf foundation. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers without delay, which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. Suria dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood with packs of polish and nails in larger quantity.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Aminata from Port Loko . She is married and has one child, one month old.  She was a housewife but she wants to contribute to support the home instead of depending on her husband alone.   

Aminata runs general stock items at her house.  She sells sardines, milk, pure water and mayonnaise. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night.  Aminata says that at present she is faced with insufficient capital to expand her business.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy more cartons of sardines, milk, and cartons of eggs. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family welfare. In the future, she plans to open another shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cartons of sardines, milk and eggs.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman with five children who go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Mwanamkuu prepares snacks, such as cashew nuts, and sells to passersby and neighbours. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 29-year-old Salamatu from Port Loko Northern area. She is married and has one child, age 8 years. 

Salamatu runs a used clothing business. She sells women's and men's clothes. She has been running this business since 2006. She works at the business 12 hours per day, seven days per week. Salamatu says that the main challenge to her business is high transportation cost due to high petrol.

Salamatu has requested a loan in order to buy more clothing for men and women. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her clothing stock. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla is 43 years old.  She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia.  She has been selling food since 2009, earning approximately $11 per day.  Her husband is a police officer who earns about $4 per day.  To expand her house’s space, Phalla is requesting a loan of $900 to purchase a plot of land next to her house.  This money will help her obtain enough space for her family to live.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child earn a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan, age 55, lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has eight children--two sons and six daughters. Four are married and live separately, one is a teacher, and the others are in school. 
Phan and her husband produce bean curd skin for sale. They also raise pigs at home. Phan is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and build a pigpen.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and build a pigpen.

loans.name: Yeretasso Group

texts.fr:
Mme VALENTINE est responsable du groupe YERETASSO. Célibataire, elle mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme transforme les céréales en grumeaux de bouillie depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché du secteur08. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 03sacs  de céréales (01sac de petit mil, 01sac de sorgho blanc, 01sac de sorgho rouge) pour la transformation en grumeaux.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour s’occuper des ses enfant et  à leur scolarisation. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin.
texts.en:
Mrs. VALENTINE is the leader of the YERETASSO group. She is a single mother to two children aged 13 and 20 who both go to school. 

Valentine processes cereals into lumps to make porridge. She has been engaged in this activity for 6 years. She buys her stock at the market of Sector 8, and she sells to both men and women. 

She plans to buy three sacks of cereals (1 sack of millet, 1 sack of white sorghum, and 1 sack of red sorghum) to process into lumps for porridge. 

She will use her profits to provide for her children and to support their studies. In the future, she would like to run a large store.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of cereals (one sack of millet, one sack of white sorghum, and one sack of red sorghum) to process into lumps for porridge.

loans.name: Roin

texts.en: Roin is a 36-year-old man. He lives with his mother in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi. His mother is provided with a retirement pension of 125 Gel per month. Roin is unemployed now and his relatives help him to cover everyday costs. He decided to start his own taxi business and requested a loan to purchase a used car. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and MFO Credo, gives him a chance to get a loan of $1000 for purchasing a used car. He  already has a driver’s license and after purchasing a car, he will serve people as a taxi driver. His calm demeanor will help him while driving. Roin will be able to generate income and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a used car

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julian vive en la comunidad de Kucya en el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo, él tiene 42 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces sus actividades económicas son la elaboración de pan, la ganadería,  la agricultura y brindar servicio de transportes, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Los tigres” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Julian lives in the village of Kucya in the district of Colquepata in the province of Paucartambo. He is 42 years old, and he and his life partner have three children. He is hardworking and motivated and helps improve his family's situation through his labor. He makes a living baking bread, raising livestock, farming, and offering transport services. Because he is very responsible, he was invited to become part of the Los Tigres village bank. He is requesting a loan at this time to buy seeds and fertilizer. He is grateful and appreciates the loan, and he is committed to making off his monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en: Sareth is 31 years old. She is single and lives with her father in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Due to problems with her transportation, Sareth is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses and go to work on time. In the future, she would like to rent a store in the market to run a  tailoring shop and build a new house next year.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Apu Los Nevados Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Apu Los Nevados” en la comunidad de Carpapampa en el distrito de Paucartambo y provincia de Paucartambo. 

Exaltación tiene 49 años de edad y es casado, él y su familia viven en la comunidad de Carpapampa.  

Exaltacion es un hombre trabajador que desde muy niño aprendió de sus padres la agricultura, la crianza de animales menores y la ganadería, él es una persona carismática y amable que sale adelante cultivando papa, trigo, cebada y avena, él en sus horas libres se dedica a la crianza de ovejas, gallinas y cuyes y también al engorde de ganado entonces él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.  
  
Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la gansería, a la crianza de animales menores, a la venta y el engorde de ganado. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the “Apu Los Nevados” communal bank in the community of Carpapampa in the district of Paucartambo and province of Paucartambo. 

Exaltación is 49 years old and is married. He and his family live in the community of Carpapampa. Exaltación is a hard-working man who learned agriculture and how to raise small animals and livestock from his parents from the time he was very young. He is a charismatic and friendly person who gets ahead by cultivating potato, wheat, barley and oatmeal. In his free time he makes a living by raising sheep, chickens and guinea pigs and also by fattening cattle. At this time he requires the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.
  
This communal bank is formed by various people who are constantly seeking opportunities to get ahead and to give their children a better future by their daily efforts. The members make a living from agriculture, livestock, raising small animals, and selling and fattening cattle. 

The members are all grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to making their various payments in the established time periods.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is a 53-year-old woman. She lives with her son, Magarram, and daughter-in-law in a small village of Gardabani district. They are not employed now. The family’s only source of income is her husband’s and son’s salary. They work in Russia. 

Their village is far from the town, and there is no convenient public transportation to the town. In the village there is a low employment rate, and people who are employed have to go to town by taxi. They have already found a car to buy for Magarram to use as a taxi, and Elmira decided to request a loan for purchasing it. The Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva and MFO Credo, gives her a chance to get a loan of $2,000. After purchasing a car, Magarram will serve local people as a taxi driver and generate income. He already has a driver’s license.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Srorn

texts.en:
Srorn, age 27, is a farmer and raises cows at home. He has been married since 2009, and he has two young sons. He lives in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His wife is a garment worker.
Srorn is requesting his first loan to put an addition on his house.

loans.use: To put an addition on his house.

loans.name: Ponny

texts.en:
Ponny is 62 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 each day. 

Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $12 daily. Due to lack of funds, Ponny is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase zinc and timber to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to generate more income to financially support the family.

loans.use: to purchase zinc and timber to fix her house.

loans.name: Ismet

texts.en:
Ismet is a married father of two children. He is working at the Water Supply Company and his wife is a housewife taking care of children. Ismet has managed to build a new house but he could not finish it because of lack of money, since the money he generates through his work is not enough for him to provide for his family and complete the house. 

For the first time, Ismet is requesting a loan so that he will be able to build a facade on his house.  Then he will achieve his goal, which is to finish a house, to have a better space and offer better security for his family. The loan will help him to improve the living conditions for his family as he is hoping to offer a better life to them.

loans.use: To facade his house

loans.name: Bedri

texts.en:
Bedri is an Ashkali man living in an Ashkali (an Albanian-speaking ethnic minority) community in Kosovo. He is married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 14 years old. At this moment, neither Bedri nor his wife are working, and they receive a regular monthly payment from his brother, who is working and living in Germany to pay for their expenses. 

As most of the residents of Ashkali communities, his family lives under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions. His house is very old with old doors and windows. His house needs some serious renovation so the family can live a healthy and normal life, especially with the upcoming cold and rainy weather. 

Bedri has requested a loan to replace the doors and windows and paint the house. He hopes this loan will improve the health of his family. He is very grateful to KosInvest lenders for improving the family's conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To replace the doors and windows and paint the house.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she is requesting a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Hing is 45 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $7 each day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $8 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Hing is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her save money on her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Phon is 54 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $6 every day. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 per day. Due to lack of funds, Phon is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase construction materials to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix her house.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Cynthia did not have access to any form of formal education.  Yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Cynthia is a seamstress. Cynthia has her own shop at Asafa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 17 years. As a divorced mother with two children, Cynthia uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Cynthia will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of the sewing materials that she uses in her sewing work.  That will aid her in improving her overall sales. Cynthia wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials for her seamstress shop

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, three of whom are in school. She has one additional family member (sister). She operates a stall selling bread, blue band, milk and tea leaves on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 700,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy milk, loaves of bread, blue band, tea leaves. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to become a wholesaler and also to build a residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more milk. loaves of bread, blue band margarine and tea leaves

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Ms.Rose is a single mother with three children, an old client of the institution, who applied for a loan of ugx.3,000,000. She runs a boutique of formal and bridal wear, on a busy street in the city center. She has been doing this for thirteen years. The purpose of the loan is to buy stock (bridal attire) so that she can raise income to keep supporting her family and support the one of her nephew with whom she stays.
Ms. Rose is an honest, very hard working single mother but is always constrained with limited capital. Her dream has always been opening up a number of branches for the same business so as to expand her income base.
Ms. Rose faces several challenges including high rent charged by landlords, competition from business people with huge working capital who tend to sell at a cheaper price, and limited capital to buy gowns for brides, which are on high demand. With this loan, she is hopeful that her customers will at least get what is asked of her.

loans.use: To buy bridal wear to sell

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 52 years old. She is married and resides, with one child, in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling desserts for more than ten years, earning about $4 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Ly is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service. This purchase will help him generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to prepare a better place for selling desserts at home and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been successfully running a shopkeeping business for a period of about four years. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Shamim needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Shamim has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Lorn is 40 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is employed in a clean water company. He earns about $10 each day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Lorn is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will enable her to save money on transportation and go to work on time. In the future, she would like to expand her business and decorate her house to make her living conditions much better.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en:
Sarith is 50 years old. He is a widower and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been running a taxi service (motor taxi) for more than ten years, earning approximately $6 daily. Three of his children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $18 per day. 

To improve his family’s living conditions, Sarith is requesting a loan of $500 to pay for an electricity connection. In addition, a part of this money will be used to purchase furniture to decorate his house. This money will also help him access other electronic tools for his daily living. In the future, he would like to help his youngest child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay for an electricity connection.

loans.name: Sol

texts.en: Sol is 42 years old. He is married and resides with a 17-year-old child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been running a taxi service for more than five years, earning approximately $8 daily. His wife sells vegetables at the market. She makes an income of $2 each day. Due to lack of funds, Sol is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase construction materials to build one more room at the ground floor of his house. This money will help him provide enough space for his family. In the future, he would like to purchase a new car to run the taxi service and help his child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build one more room at the ground floor of his house

loans.name: Yieng

texts.en: Yieng is 60 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish and bananas for over ten years, earning approximately $10 daily. Two of her children employed in a garment factory. They earn about $8 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Yieng is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a generator to run an arc welding business. This purchase will help her to run an additional business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a generator to run arc welding business.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly is 33 years old. He is married and lives with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been working in construction since 2008, earning approximately $6 daily. His wife is a garment worker who makes an income of $4 each day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Sokly is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to construct a building for his client. This money will help him generate more profit. In the future, he would like to expand his business and help his children earn a higher education. Moreover, he hopes to rebuild his house to be more convenient for the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to construct a building for his client.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Although he has received no prior formal education, Benjamin is an entrepreneur. He specializes in plantain farming and the selling of gari in Asafa (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Benjamin is married and has five children. His wife is unemployed. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Benjamin wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels, hence allowing him to sell greater quantities of gari and also buy farm inputs to enhance his farming activities. In the long term, Benjamin plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase inventory and to buy farm inputs to enhance his farming activities

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en: Khuon is 52 years old. She is widowed and blessed with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating vegetables to sell and in tailoring for more than two years, earning approximately $5 daily. Both of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 each day. In order to improve her family‘s livelihood, Khuon is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation. This money will help her acquire the ability to start a new business and generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to take another loan from KREDIT to fix her house.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income that she used in her coconut business. 

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more sacks of coconuts for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Zeeba

texts.en:
Zeeba is a 31-year-old, married woman. For the last three years, she has been successfully running a business of flower-making. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events, like birthdays, parties, etc. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies them in the local market.  

Zeeba has good communication skills and has a good client list. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy raw materials, such as glace papers, tissue papers, florist tape, and wire, along with packs of paints in various colors. In this way, she would be able to consistently meet the increasing demands of her customers. 

Zeeba wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as glace papers, tissue papers, florist tape, and wire, along with packs of paints in various colors.

loans.name: Vida's Group

texts.en:
This is a group of five women who sell slippers, wax-prints, scarves and plantains. 

Vida from Tehie-Accra, Ghana, is 52 years old and she is the representative of this group. She is a widow with three children; two adults and one dependent who is attending school.
 
Vida runs a retail business selling scarves and wax-prints. The business has been in operation for eight years. Vida requested a loan of GHS 500 to buy wax-prints and scarves to supply to customers around the town. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, Vida plans to complete the housing project left behind by her late husband.

They need a total amount of GHS 1,700 to stock their businesses.

loans.use: To buy wax-prints and scarves to supply to customers around the town.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a firewood and charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal and firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Makfirete

texts.en:
Makfirete is 39 years old, married and has two children, 5 and 8 years old. Her husband works in construction and she is a housewife, staying home to care for the family needs and home. Makfirete and her husband have managed to build a new house but the second floor is still incomplete because they lacked the money to finish it. 

For this reason she is requesting a loan for the first time so that she can complete the second floor and allow them to have a better space and security for her family. The loan will help her to improve the living conditions for her family as she is hoping to offer a better life to her family and reach her goal to be able to contribute to her family's needs. She wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To complete the second floor.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim is 36 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is also working in a garment factory. He earns about $4 each day also. 

Due to a lack of funds, Chim is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase construction materials to fix her house. This money will help provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix her house.

loans.name: Sokmom

texts.en:
Sokmom is 29 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He makes an income of about $5 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sokmom is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a cow to breed and resell for a profit. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed and resell for a profitable price.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Kyrey está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que mostró que 10 de ellas están con ingresos muy bajos, y quienes necesitan trabajar más para ir mejorando, y por medio de las capacitaciones también podrán hacerlo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elisa, quien se dedica a la venta de comestible, también se debe destacar el trabajo y el esfuerzo que ella pone para poder salir adelante. Comenta que tiene muy buena venta y que ya se hizo de muy buena clientela y es por eso que quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, harinas, leche, etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y también seguir con la elaboración de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Kuña Kyrey is participating in the poverty elimination survey and demonstrated that the members are of low income need to work more in order to improve; they will be able to do it through training.

Elisa is one of the members and she sells food and she gets ahead through her efforts.  She says that her sales are good and that she has good customers and wants to continue investing in her business.  She is asking for a loan to buy meat, flour, milk, etc., which will help her solidify her business plan, which will help her increase her income and allow her to continue making her food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una persona muy trabajadora, es una persona que desde siempre ha trabajador para salir adelante, su despensa es su medio de trabajo y con lo cual ha podido salir adelante. Este es su segundo préstamo, el anterior lo ha utilizado en insumos para poder surtir su negocio.
Solicita de este nuevo crédito para poder usarlo en la compra de comestibles, bebidas, verduras, carnes y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y creciendo.
texts.en:
Julia is a very hard-working person. She is someone who has always worked hard in order to get on in life. Her small grocery store is her means of employment and has enabled her to make progress in life.

This is Julia's second loan; she used the first one to buy supplies to stock her business. She is asking for this new loan to buy food, drinks, vegetables, meat and other supplies so she can carry on working and expanding.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, vegetables, meat and other items.

loans.name: Sreylak

texts.en:
Sreylak is 21 years old. She is married and resides with her one-year-old child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $8 each day. 

In order to improve her husband’s business, Sreylak is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials for her husband to use in his business. This purchase will help him to acquire the ability to build houses for his clients. In the future, Sreylak would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her husband to use in his business.

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
After graduating Junior High School, Hagar decided to set up her own provision business, selling soap, sugar and tinned fish in Asafa (near Cape Coast). With over a year's worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more soap, sugar and tinned fish for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house, while also ensuring that their future children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more soap, sugar and tinned fish for resale.

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Bernice is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells fish and ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She can be found selling ‘Kenkey’ in Asafa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. Bernice is married and has 3 children. Her husband works as a mason. 

The proceeds from her ‘Kenkey’ business normally goes towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. Bernice will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Bernice plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
Sreytouch, age 44, is single. She lives with her sister, nephew and niece in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, across the Mekong River.
She sells motorbike spare parts in her village. Her sister is a cleaner and she commutes to work by taking a motorbike everyday. However, the motorcycle is old and breaking down, so Sreytouch decided to ask for a loan in order to buy a new motorbike for her sister.
Photo: Sreytouch is a woman, but she looks like a man.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her sister.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Sreypov, age 22, is a cobbler in a shoe factory. She has been married since 2011 and has just one young son. Her husband raises pigs at home and produces rice wine. Sreypov is asking for a loan to assist in her husband’s pig farming business by purchasing additional piglets to raise, and also to buy pig feeds. 

In the Photo: Sreypov and her husband.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s pig farming business by purchasing additional piglets to raise, and also to buy pig feeds.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en: Mbeyu appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of Ksh.30,000 to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is 24 years old; he lives in Gaza with his wife.  

To support their needs, in 2010, he started selling various kinds of pickles in a shop. Now Saleh is requesting this youth loan to buy general food products so he will be able to increase sales. Earnings will allow him to have other business activities and to take care of his family.

Saleh is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Missekple Ii Group

texts.fr: MISSEKPLE II est un groupement de quinze personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, Julienne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à Martin, un cultivateur. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Julienne n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pour ce faire, Julienne vend de la nourriture(du riz accompagné de sauce tomate et du macaroni)dans sa région depuis cinq. Julienne s’approvisionne dans sa région. C’est la première fois que Julienne, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement MISSEKPLE II sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de diversifier leur activité.
texts.en:
MISSEKPLE Ii is a group of fifteen people who live in the same village. The group’s representative is Julienne, age 38, seen in the photo with her hand raised. Julienne is married to a farmer named Martin, and the couple have four dependent children, some of whom go to school. 

Julienne never received any schooling. She lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, Julienne has been selling prepared food (rice with tomato sauce, macaroni) locally for the past five years. She buys her supplies locally as well. This is the first time that Julienne and the other group members are seeking financial support from ALIDé to help diversify their activities.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi is married. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She sells fruits. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits for resale in her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits for resale in her business.

loans.name: Ndugu

texts.en:
Ndugu is asking for a new loan because she believes that through it, she will improve her business.

The previous loan enabled her to to save money to open a mat-weaving business. However, she still operates her business selling cashew nuts. She is requesting for a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase palm leaves for her business.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan.  To date it has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves for her business.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Meet 46-year-old Queen from Port Loko northern area in Sierra Leone. She is widowed and has five children between the ages of 17 years and 26 years. She also has three relatives at home. 

In 2005, Queen established her food stand business within a busy market area. She began her business because she did not go to school and she was trained in business. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation of goods.

Queen requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasoning. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her standard of living and repay her loan. In the future, Queen plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is 42 years old and lives in Airport community. She is a high school graduate. She is married and has three children between 10 and 28 years old, but only two of her children are in school and live at home. Her husband is a local businessman. For the past 12 years she been selling frozen fish in the local market. She started this business by selling for her mother and she learned this trade from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more frozen fish for her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen fish for her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman and owns a house that has no piped water or electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food. She has operated a tailoring business for the past few years. She makes women's and ladies' suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase fabrics and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a 45 year old married woman. She deals in the business of animal sales and purchases. She has one cow, one buffalo and three goats. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her family members. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of five persons who are friends living in the same district. The group's representative, Victoria, standing far left in the photo, is 39 years old. She did attend school to the high school level, and she is married to a businessman named Emmanuel. The couple have two children, all in school and in their care. Victoria lives with her husband and children. The household expenses are covered by the couple. For this reasons, Victoria has been selling "silver" products out of her home for sixteen years. She gets her supplies from a market in Ghana. 

With the goal of diversifying her business and earning a loyal customer base, Victoria joined with the other members to request a total third loan amount of GHS 3200 from ID-Ghana. The previous loans were used judiciously  and were indeed repaid promptly. The other members of the group are into wax-prints, detergents and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy "silver" products and sell them to customers.

loans.name: Resedá Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Resedá está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de ellas necesitan una mayor capacitación para ir mejorando su vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Estefana, quien trabaja como  empleada doméstica, y hoy quiere poder emprender en la venta de frutas y verduras. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que con gran esfuerzo quiere poder ir mejorando su vida. También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones.
La Sra. Estefana solicita este crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Resedá group is in its 7th cycle of the women's committee programme, in which they all work and help each other to get on in life. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, in which 2 of them need additional training in order to make improvements to their life.

One of the members is Estefana who works in domestic service and now wants to set up in business selling fruit and vegetables. She is a hard-working person with a lot of drive, and by putting in a lot of effort she wants to make improvements to her life.  The work of the advisors must also be highlighted, as they constantly monitor training and follow-up.

Estefana is asking for this loan to buy fruit and vegetables, which will help her to set up her business plan, which in turn will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to start a new business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, one of whom is in school. She has no additional family members. She operates a beauty salon from home on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy hair treatments, relaxers, shampoo, and rollers. Her major business challenge is electricity. 

Her goal and aspiration is to increase her sales through customer satisfaction. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more hair treatments, relaxers, shampoo and rollers.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Araba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling porridge and charcoal in Asafa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 3 years. Araba is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Araba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of porridge and charcoal. In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal and porridge.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of ksh 40,000 to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling smoked fish in Asafa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 15 years. Aba is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Aba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of smoked fish. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of smoked fish.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of ksh 15,000 to buy more stock of household consumables, like wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, like wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health care. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives on a small farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano. Its proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Catherine is married, and has four children. Her husband works as a customer service representative for Kenya Power and Lighting Company, while Catherine works on projects around their land. She has been farming for twenty years, and is currently growing maize and sorghum on her land. She is excited to start beekeeping because “the involvement is minimal and the returns are good.”

This is Catherine’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to pay for her children’s school fees. Catherine’s hope for the future is to invest enough in her farm “to have many projects bringing in cash flow.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge in her business, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama, a single mother of one child, is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells fufu and ‘Banku’ for a living (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). Involved in this business for about 20 years, she normally sells her ‘Banku’ in Asafa, near Cape Coast. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family.


Ama will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava in order to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the food products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava in order to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 33 year old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchases for the past six years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She also deals in milk sales to generate an extra amount of income. Currently she requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Junta De Saneamiento Caaguazu Group

texts.es:
La junta de saneamiento Caaguazu se encuentra situada en la ciudad de Ñemby, ciudad colindante de Villa Elisa.
En el año 1993 por la necesidad de acceder al agua potable en la zona fue fundada la Junta por vecinos del barrio haciendo actividades sociales para adquirir fondos de esa forma perforar un pozo, y haciéndole las instalaciones de cañerías y así poner en funcionamiento la Junta. 
Fue así que empezó con 180 usuarios, un pozo artesiano y un reservorio. En la actualidad tiene 3363 usuarios, 4 pozos, 4 reservorios, un tanque elevado de 50.000 litros y una comisión directiva bien constituida. Gracias a esto muchas familias pueden tener acceso al liquido vital tan importante que es el agua.
El crédito solicitado de la Fundación Paraguaya será destinado a la perforación de otro pozo más y de esa forma cumplir a cabalidad con el abastecimiento a todos los usuarios en este verano ya que en esa época el vital líquido se usa el doble, y también cumplir con la demanda de conexiones futura. En la foto del crédito aparecen los Sres. Jorge y Serapio, quienes son los encargados de esta aguatería, y quienes estan dando todo de si en esa proyecto y quienes aparecen como firmantes del crédito.
texts.en:
The Caaguazu Sanitation Board is located in the city of Ñemby, which is adjacent to the city of Villa Elisa.  In 1993, the Board was established in order to address the need for accessing safe drinking water.  The residents of this neighborhood held fundraising activities to acquire the money needed to dig a well and install plumbing, functions that fall under the authority of the Board.  

An artesian well and reservoir was built to support 180 users at the beginning.  There are currently 3,343 users, four wells, four reservoirs, an elevated tank that holds 50,000 liters, and a well-organized executive committee.  Thanks to these efforts, many families have vital access to water.  

The loan being requested from Fundación Paraguaya will be used to drill another well in order to satisfy the demand for water this summer for all users.  During this season, the demand for water is double than usual.  This loan will also meet the demand for future connections. In the photo are Jorge and Serapio, who are in charge of this water source and managing this project, and who are co-signers on the loan.

loans.use: to drill another well in order to meet user demand.

loans.name: Jóvenes Activos Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jóvenes Activos está en su 1er ciclo del programa de comité de jóvenes, donde ellos quieren poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo. Los integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada uno de ellos.
Alexander es parte de este grupo, el se dedica a la venta de discos, y con esto quiere ayudar a su familia, aportando en algo para sentirse útil. El solicita de este crédito para la compra de discos, con los cuales quiere poder seguir creciendo y vendiendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
The group called "Jóvenes Activos" [Active Youngsters] is in its first cycle of the young people's committee, in which they want to try to help their families through their work. The members of the committee have determined that their own development is their main objective.

Alexander is a member of this group. He earns a living selling discs and by doing this he wants to help his family, making himself feel useful by contributing in some way. 

He is asking for this loan to buy discs, with which he can continue expanding and selling. He is grateful for this opportunity which he is being given.

loans.use: to buy discs to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Aty Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa Aty es un grupo nuevo, esta en el ciclo uno del programa de comité, además de eso están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder seguir creciendo.
La Sra. Sinthia forma parte de este grupo, decidió formar parte ya que vio una gran oportunidad, pues quiere capacitarse y seguir creciendo. Ella vende prendas, y con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante, quiere seguir trabajando para mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Solicita de este préstamo para poder seguir trabajando y tener así más prendas que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kuña Guapa Aty is a new group who is in their first loan cycle with the committee program.  They are also participanting in the poverty elimination survey to be able to continue growing.

Sinthia is a member of the group.  She decided to join the group since she saw a great opportunity, since she wanted training and to continue growing.  She sells clothing.  With a lot of work and effort, she is moving forward.  She wants to continue working to improve her life and the lives of her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to continue working and have more clothing to be able to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
El Sr. Demetrio tiene 52 años, está casado hace más 15 años, tiene 2 hijos y viven en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Don Demetrio proviene de una familia que netamente se dedica a la fabricación y venta de artesanías, él empezó desde muy temprana edad a salir con su padre a vender los productos que ellos mismos fabrican, en poco tiempo logró juntar un poco de capital para empezar a comprar más variedad de artículos y llevar a vender por la zona de Caacupé donde ya tiene una buena clientela formada. Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  pudo comprarse una motocicleta  la cual lo utiliza para realizar sus ventas y mantener la buena clientela.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo ya que le será de mucha ayuda
texts.en:
Sr. Demetrio is 52 years old and has been married for more than 15 years.  He has two children and lives in the city of Carapeguá.  

Don Demetrio comes from a family that makes and sells handicrafts.  He started at a young age by going out with his father to sell the products that they had made.  Within a short amount of time, he was able to raise a bit of capital so that he could buy a wider variety of products.  He now sells in the District of Caacupé where he has an established clientele.  Thanks to his work and efforts, he was able to buy a motorcycle which he uses for making sales and maintaining a good clientele.  

Demetrio is requesting a loan in order to buy hammocks, blankets, sashes, and bed sheets since he has many orders for these products.  He is grateful for the opportunity he has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blankets, sashes, and bed sheets that have been ordered by his customers.

loans.name: Mwanamwinyi

texts.en:
Mwanamwinyi appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards.  Her loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy more stocks of household consumables, such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, rice, oil, etc., to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fried fish in Asafa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. 

Aba is married and has five children; her husband is a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.
 
Aba will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has four children who attend school. She operates a food making business, making items such as beans and chapati (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbors. 

Fatuma is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Flodouard

texts.en:
Flodouard, a married father of five children, all in school, has requested a Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer purchases to increase his maize production.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers in order to increase production.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario es casado con la Sra. Gasparina hace varios años, tienen dos hijos quienes aun están en edad escolar por quienes ambos se esfuerzan día a día para poder sacarlos adelante.
 Don Mario tiene un taller de refrigeración en su casa ya hace varios años, además de su trabajo que realiza su esposa tiene una despensa bien surtida quien ayuda también con los gastos de sus hijos y del hogar. El ha demostrado ser una persona honesta y responsable en sus compromisos. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios ya que llega en la temporada en  que mas trabajo tiene y quiere poder comprar repuestos para usar. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Mario has been married to Gasparina for several years and they have two children who are still of school age, and for whom they both make a daily effort to get ahead.

Mario has a refrigeration workshop in his home and has had it for a few years.  His wife also runs a well-stocked grocery store and helps with the children’s and household expenses.  He has demonstrated himself as being an honest and responsible person and is asking for a loan to invest in his business, as his busy season is approaching and he wants to buy spare parts to use.  He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Asafa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ for 20 years. 

Ekua is married and has six children. Her husband is a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally goes towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Ekua wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. 

In the long term, Ekua plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels

loans.name: Docars

texts.en:
Docars is 40 years old and lives in a community around Airport; she is single and has two children ages 5 and 16 who are currently in school and living at home. 

For the past five years she has been selling sweet potatoes and greens in the local market. She started selling for mother, and later for herself. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more sweet potatoes and greens for her business. 

Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more sweet potatoes and greens for her business

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama, a 24-year-old hardworking and friendly single man who lives in Hodeida, Yemen, offers good transportation services to his clients. The owner of a minibus, he is working hard to increase his profit. 


Because his bus is not running well, Osama has requested a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts to repair it. He thanks Kiva lenders for providing his previous loan and hopes they will fund this loan as well.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his bus.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the workers who will prune the coffee plants.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and old parents). She operates a pub in a shop that she rents. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years and works six days a week.

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 1,200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more jerrycan of local brew, crates of beer, soda, and local gin. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. 

Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked pub and build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medications, school fees, and food.

loans.use: to buy more jerycans of local Gin, local brew, and crates of beer and soda for her pub.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Alice did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. For four years now, Alice has been selling fried fish in Asafa, near Cape Coast. As a single mother of two children, she uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 


Alice will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of fish to improve her overall sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fish to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts to improve the efficiency of his taxi, and thus improve his profit levels.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El Sr. Ruben está casado con la Sra. Fermina  hace varios años, tienen 3 hijos menores que aun están en la escuela primaria, ellos juntos montaron una despensa en su casa, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizado anteriormente como asalariados.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando  educan a sus hijos  y están saliendo adelante. El Sr. Ruben además de la despensa trabaja como transporte alternativo  en el centro de la ciudad.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, comestibles, bebidas, y demás y con ello seguir trabajando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo de seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Ruben has been married to Fermina for several years and they have three young children who are still in elementary school. Together they set up a grocery store in their home which they started with a little bit of capital they had earned previously as salaried workers. Thanks to the work they are doing, they are able to educate their children and are getting ahead. In addition to working in the store, Ruben provides alternative transportation in the city center.

Ruben is asking for this loan so he can invest it in supplies for his store such as vegetables, groceries, drinks, and other things so that he can continue to work. He appreciates this opportunity to continue working.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, groceries, drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Jovenes Activos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo Jovenes activos es de la ciudad de Luque son 5 jóvenes que se unieron con el objetivo de poder empezar a trabajar y salir adelante para ayudar a sus familias. Ellos están muy entusiasmados ya que podrán ayudar con los ingresos de la casa, y de esa forma poder sentirse útiles.
Uno de estos jóvenes es Rozana, quien tiene 17 años, cuenta que está trabajando haciendo zapatillas bordadas para vender. Ella es una joven de muy buena familia, todos son muy trabajadores, y quieren poder seguir el ejemplo que sus papas le dieron, y de esa forma poder ayudarles y que se sientan orgullosos de ellos. 
Pide de este crédito para la compra de helados para la venta ya que se acerca el tiempo de calor y hay mucha venta, quiere poder tener otro emprendimiento además de su venta de zapatillas bordadas lo que le ayudará a poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
This group of active young people is from the city of Luque.  It’s five young people that joined together in order to start working to get ahead and to help their families.  They are very excited because they’ll be able to help with household income and feel useful that way.

One of these young people is Rozana, 17.  She says that she’s been working making embroidered slippers to sell.  She’s from a very good family; all of them are very hard workers and want follow the example their parents set for them and to help them this way so that they will feel proud of them.

She’s requesting this loan to buy ice-cream to sell because the hot weather is approaching and sales are good.  She wants to have another business in addition to the sale of embroidered slippers that will help her to continue with her schooling.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream to sell.

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
