Zareena is 35 years old and married. Many years ago she started her business of milk sales with the support of her husband. She has six buffaloes and a cow. 

Due to her efforts and her work, she is honored in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. She uses the milk of cow for her personal use, but the milk of buffaloes her husband sells in the market, and the remaining milk she sells in the neighborhood. This way, both are earning a healthy income to support their family. 

She shared the feeling of achievement she has from sending her children to school for better education. 

She is in her third loan cycle with the BRAC Pakistan. She has some past savings, and she has applied for a loan to purchase another buffalo for getting milk to sell. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

She is very thankful to the kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for getting milk to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña guapa es un grupo muy trabajadora, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, quien tiene un copetín donde vende todo tipo de productos, como ser golosinas, comestibles y demás. Ella con su mayor sacrificio está saliendo adelante ya que su negocio es la manera en la que sustenta a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, gaseosas, comestibles, golosinas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas e invirtiendo en su negocio como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
“Kuña Guapa” is a very hardworking group in the city of Curuguaty, a zone that’s a bit far from the central zone that’s still growing.  It’s difficult to reach so the members of this group want to strive to continue growing and to give the zone they live in a better environment and to continue growing slowly.

María is one of the members.  She has a snack bar where she sells all types of snacks, food items and others.  She’s getting ahead by means of her maximum effort since her business is her way of supporting her family.

She’s requesting this loan to buy beverages, soft-drinks, food items, snacks and others to continue with her sales and investing in her business like she’s been doing.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 26 años vive con sus padres y hermanas, trabaja en una empresa por las mañanas  y por la  tarde va a la Facultad, está cursando el último año de la carrera de Licenciatura en Química, una vez  que termine su carrera quiere trabajar en un laboratorios de producción en la parte de Control de Calidad, y de esa forma poder realizarse como profesional.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus estudios, ya que tiene un trabajo de investigación que pagar y quiere poder solventarlo.
texts.en:
María, 26, lives with her parents and sisters. She works mornings in a firm and attends university in the evening.  She’s in the last year of a Bachelor’s in Chemistry.  Once she completes her career she wants to work in the Quality Control department of a laboratory and be fulfilled as a professional this way.

She’s asking for this loan to invest in her schooling since she has a research project to pay for and she wants to be able to afford it.

loans.use: to pay for a research project.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén  tiene 19 años y tiene 2 hermanos, es el único que estudia, unas de sus aspiraciones es terminar su facultad y ejercer su profesión ya que es el único que sigue una carrera universitaria.
Su mama es peluquera y ella es su mayor inspiración, quiere darle esa satisfacción a su madre por el esfuerzo que ella está haciendo para que siga estudiando.
Solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Rubén is 19 years old and has two siblings. He is the only one who is a student. One of his dreams is to complete his studies and pursue his profession as he is the only one working on a university degree.  His mother is a hair dresser and she has been his greatest inspiration.  He wants to give her this satisfaction in return for all of the effort she is making to enable him to continue his studies. 

Rubén is requesting this loan to pay his tuition and be able to continue to study.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a widow and has eight children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ekua is a successful businesswoman. She sells charcoal  in Esebu (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about six years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of bags of charcoal, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 17 años vive con sus padres, el prepara productos de limpieza y los vende.
Por la mañana va al colegio  y por la  tarde sale a vender sus productos, está cursando el último año del colegio, y anhela  estudiar en la Universidad.
Es un joven que pese a su temprana edad se preocupa por poder crecer y algún día ser un gran profesional. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de los tramites de su culminación de año del colegio, ya que debe pagar muchos aranceles. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo de estudiar.
texts.en:
Luis, 17, lives with his parents.  He manufactures cleaning supplies to sell.  He attends high-school in the morning and sells his products in the afternoon.  He’s attending his final year of high-school and hopes to attend university.

He’s a young man who despite his young age is concerned about being able to grow and to become a great professional someday.  He’s asking for this loan to be able to pay his final fees for his last year in high-school since he has several pending.  He’s grateful for the opportunity he’s being given.

loans.use: to pay high-school fees.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian es alumno regular del 2to año de la carrera Administración de Empresas, es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es un joven con muchas aspiraciones y con ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente está trabajando como vendedor ambulante. Su objetivo es llegar a recibirse  como Administrador de Empresas y luego trabajar en la profesión y montar su propia empresa y poder dirigirla.
El solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y también pagar sus clases, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y luchando por salir adelante.
texts.en: Julián is a second year Business Administration student from the city of Carapeguá.  He’s a young man with many hopes and a strong drive to get ahead.  He’s currently working as a street vendor and his goal is to graduate with a degree in Business Administration and then work in his profession setting up and managing his own firm.   He’s asking for this loan to pay tuition and fees in order to continue studying and striving to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay university tuition and fees.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a married woman with three children, all of whom still attend school and under her care. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

She has been operating a vegetable selling business, which she sells at the market and to her town dwellers and neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality, and she dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two kales, cabbages, onions, and row maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two kales, cabbages, onions, and row maize for resale.

loans.name: Dionicio Roberth

texts.es: Dionicio es un joven que vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba, es soltero, vive junto  a sus padres. Principalmente Dionicio trabaja en la construcción como albañil; también trabaja cuidando las vacas de su familia, todos los días se levanta muy temprano para dar de comer a las vacas lecheras para luego ir a trabajar como albañil, al regresar de su trabajo  Dionocio se encarga de ordeñar y cuidar a las vacas.  Dionicio solicita el crédito para terminar de construir su cuarto en su  vivienda, ya que aún le faltaban algunas mejoras para que su cuarto sea habitable.
texts.en:
Dionicio's a single young man who lives with his parents in the city of Cochabamba.

Dionicio works primarily in construction as a bricklayer.  He also takes care of his family's dairy cows.  He gets up early every day to feed the cows and then goes to work as a bricklayer.  When he returns from work he milks and takes care of the cows.

Dionicio's requesting the loan to finish building a room on his house.  He needs to make some improvements for his room to be habitable.

Among his plans for the future, Henry wants to get another loan to buy cows so he can improve his income and consequently his quality of life.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Elvio

texts.es:
Elvio vive con sus padres y trabaja en el negocio familiar, actualmente es el administrador, es estudiante esta en el 4° año de  la carrera de Administración de Empresas. Trabajando y estudiando al mismo tiempo cuenta que culminar sus estudios universitarios es su meta, para de esta manera demostrar a su familia su capacidad. 
Su mayor aspiración es poder algún día administrar su propio negocio, y desea poder lograrlo en un futuro no muy lejano. Solicitó de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y también para sus gastos del día a día, que van surgiendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está teniendo de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Elvio lives with his parents and works in the family business; he’s currently the manager.  He’s a fourth-year Business Administration student.  He works and attends classes at the same time and relates that his goal is to complete his university studies in order to show his family his capabilities.

His greatest wish is to someday be able to manage his own business and would like to do so in the not too distant future.  He requested this loan to be able to pay his tuition and also to cover his day-to-day costs that come up.  He’s grateful for this opportunity he’s getting to be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees and to cover his day-to-day needs.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Sagrada Familia está en su ciclo número 1 las integrantes vieron una gran oportunidad a la hora de formar el comité, ya que les permitirá crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas.
Emilia, una de las integrantes es modista, una mujer muy trabajadora, que siempre se ha esforzado por ayudar a su familia. Comenta que desde que empezó hasta hoy ya se hizo de muy buena clientela. Solicita hoy de esta ayuda para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes, seguir ayudando a su familia y creciendo como persona.
texts.en:
The group "Sagrada Familia" is in its first loan cycle. The members realised that forming a group was a great opportunity, allowing them to grow not only financially but also as people.

Emilia is one of the members and is a dressmaker. She is hardworking and always makes a lot of effort to help her family. She notes that from the time she began dressmaking up to the present day, she has gained many good customers. Now she is seeking a loan to buy fabric, thread, glue etc. so she can continue providing her customers with good service, supporting her family, and growing as a person.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread, glue etc.

loans.name: Renato

texts.es:
El señor  Renato,  vive en la comunidad de cabra cancha,  tiene tres hijos dependientes, Renato se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en unas pequeñas parcelas que sus padre le dejo, en la anterior cosecha hubo  desastre natural de helada  y sus cultivos bajaron de rendimiento, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos que  mantiene  con la producción agrícola. 
Renato es una persona  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicado a sus pequeños hijos  y su trabajo pese que el sufre de una enfermedad y que a veces hasta tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura en otras zonas para ganar algunos pesos y así mantener a toda su familia, sus pequeño hijos asisten a la escuela distante a cuatro kilómetros de su vivienda, el  está solicitando el crédito para comprar semilla de papa,  y abono orgánico y de esta forma mejorara la calidad y el rendimiento de sus cultivos, que trabaja en su pequeña parcela que tiene en el lugar donde vive  para mejorar sus ingreso económicos  y  darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y que ellos  puedan asistir a la escuela  en mejores condiciones.  El crédito ayudara mucho a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Renato lives in the community of Cabra Cancha. He has three dependent children. Renato works in agriculture on some small plots of land that his parents left him. 

In the previous harvest, there was a natural disaster from frost, and his crop yield was decreased. This catastrophe made a failure of his economic income that he maintains with his agricultural production. 

Renato is a person who is loved and respected in the place where he lives, as he is dedicated to his small children and his work. This is despite the facts that he suffers from an illness and that he sometimes has to work as an agricultural laborer in other areas to earn a few pesos and in this way support his entire family. 

His young children attend a school four kilometers from their home. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase potato seeds and organic fertilizer. In this way, he will improve the quality and yield of his crops. 

He works on a small piece of land that he has on the place where he lives in order to improve his economic income and give a better quality of life to his children, so they will be able to attend school under better conditions. The loan will help his entire family a great deal.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry es una persona trabajadora, vive junto a sus padres en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Tiene su taller de confección de guardapolvos para los estudiantes. Desde muy joven a trabajado costurando y confeccionando, poco a poco fue comprando maquina de costura y ahora Henry necesita una maquina nueva para poder trabajar con mayor eficiencia en su actividad y así pueda mejorar su nivel de vida,  por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de una nueva máquina de costura para continuar su actividad y aumentar su productividad, de esta manera lograra tener mayores ingresos a futuro que le otorgaran un mejor nivel de vida para él y sus padres.
texts.en:
Henry is a hardworking person; he lives with his parents in the city of Cochabamba. He has a workshop where he makes overalls for students. He has worked from a young age, sewing and making things. Little by little he was able to buy a sewing machine but now Henry needs a new machine to work more efficiently and thus improve his standard of living.

He is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine to continue his work and increase productivity, thus earning a better income to improve living conditions for himself and his parents.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Oscar Daniel

texts.es: Oscar, a sus 27 años de edad se encuentra desempleado por lo que ha pasado por una difícil situación económica, pues hasta el momento no ha sido posible comenzar a trabajar por falta de oportunidades laborales. Es por esta razón que desea iniciar su propio negocio y así generar los recursos económicos suficientes para solventar las necesidades y gastos básicos de su hogar. Desde montar un café internet y papelería, para lo cual ya tomó en arriendo un local y desea comprar activos fijos (computadores, vitrinas, sillas y mesas) y surtido de papelería al por mayor (cuadernos, lapiceros, marcadores, entre otros), para lo cual está solicitando el apoyo del crédito. De esta forma pretende dar inicio a su proyecto de negocio y prestar un buen servicio ofreciendo alternativas de estudio para sus clientes. Oscar espera que su negocio sea rentable y perdure en el tiempo, siendo reconocido por la excelente calidad del servicio que prestará, pero es consciente que para lograrlo debe trabajar con mucho empeño y dedicación, sólo así tendrá la oportunidad de progresar y en un futuro poder disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar, 27, is currently unemployed so has been going through a difficult economic situation because he’s been unable to find employment to date because of the lack of employment opportunities.  This is why he wants to start a business of his own to thus generate sufficient income to cover his basic household needs and expenses.  

He wants to open an Internet café and stationery store and to do so has already rented a space.  He wants to buy fixed assets (computers, display cases, tables and chairs) and to buy stock stationery supplies (notebooks, pencils, markers, etc.) and this is why he’s asking for a loan.

In this way, he intends to start his business venture and provide good service offering study alternatives for his customers.  Oscar hopes that his business will be profitable and that it will last over time becoming well-known because of the excellent service he’ll provide.  But he’s aware that to do so he must work with much effort and dedication.  That’s the only way that he’ll have the opportunity to make progress and in future enjoy better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets and supplies.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. She is a tailor. She sells her products on retail and wholesale basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She gets additional income from selling piped water. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy more rolls of fabric for making clothes and to buy an electric sewing machine. Her major business challenge is electricity and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy more electric sewing machines and also to train youth in tailoring. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, school fees, and food.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of fabric and an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Olivier

texts.en:
Olivier is a father of two children, ages 3 and 7. He has been a maize farmer for the past nine years. He wants to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and to purchase fertilizer during maize production. Fertilizer is important to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a special seat for manicures and pedicures, stock at wholesale prices (hair treatments, shampoo, nail polish, cosmetics etc.), and a display case.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
uan es un estudiante que se destaca por el gran esfuerzo que está haciendo, quiere ser un gran profesional que pueda ayudar a las personas por medio de sus conocimientos.
Está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y cuenta que se ve ejerciendo su profesión ayudando también a su familia por medio de esto. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, para poder cubrir ese costo y así seguir estudiando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo y con lo cual podrá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Juan is a student that stands out because of the great effort he’s making. He wants to become a great professional in order to help people with his knowledge.  He’s studying Accounting and he says that he sees himself helping his family this way too.  


He’s requesting this loan to pay tuition to cover this cost and be able to continue with his studies.  He’s grateful for the opportunity he’s getting that will make it possible for him to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 27 years old and lives in the Airport community. She is married and has three children between 1 and 18 years old, only two of whom are attending school, and they all live at home. Over the past three years she has been selling red-oil, salt, pepper, rice, etc., in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday spending 10 hours each day. A problem she faces is the rainy season. She got money from her friend to start her business and learned trading from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red-oil, salt, pepper, rice, etc., for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more red-oil, salt, pepper, rice, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
Cristo Rey está en el 4º ciclo del programa de comité ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron con el propósito de poder mejorar sus vidas y la de sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Benita es miembro del grupo, ella es empleada de una empresa, se esfuerza al máximo para llegar a ser una mujer exitosa y lo está consiguiendo a través del trabajo continuo.  Quiere poder emprender un nuevo trabajo para que de esa forma pueda ayudar más a su familia. La señora solicita este crédito para poder emprender en la venta de prendas, y de esa forma ir mejorando sus ingresos y poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
“Cristo Rey” (Christ the King) is in its 4th cycle in the committee program.  They are female heads of household that joined together to be able to improve their and their loved ones’ lives.

Benita is a group member.    She’s employed in a firm and strives to the maximum to become a successful woman and she’s accomplishing this by means of her non-stop work.  

She wants to be able to start a new business to help her family more this way.  She’s asking for this loan to start selling clothes thus improving her income and being able to give her family everything she did not have.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
Antonieta, de 45 años, está casada con Gabino, de 46 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero cuida de dos de ellas
en su casa propia. Hace 20 años que se dedicó a la agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de frutos como piña, y cítricos.Pero como Antonia tiene que mandar constantemente dinero a la capital, donde su hija Felicita, estudia Contabilidad en una universidad reconocida; abrió hace tan solo 2 años una tienda de comestibles donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los habitantes de su localidad, es así que ella quiere seguir trabajando arduamente para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante. Este es su tercer crédito con KIVA, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos, por ello promete ser puntual con sus pagos. Con el monto solictado de S/.1000 soles comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
Antonieta, who is 45 years old, is married to Gabino, who is 46 years old. They have three children, but they care for two of them in their home.

Twenty years ago, she began working in agriculture. Her main crops consisted of fruits like pineapple and citrus fruits. Because Antonia constantly had to send money to the capital, where her daughter Felicita is studying accounting at a well-known university, she opened a small grocery store two years ago. She sells convenience items to the people in her area.

She wants to continue to work hard to be able to bring her children forward. This is her third loan with KIVA and she feels developed and happy. She hopes to obtain the loan to continue working towards her goals and she promises to make her payments on time.

With the requested loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, she will buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Missessin Iv Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MISSESSIN IV est formé de quatorze personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Pascaline est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Pascaline est âgée de 32 ans, et est mariée à Arnaud, un cultivateur. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux sont à leur charge. Pascaline vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont assumées par le couple. Pascaline n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Pascaline vend depuis trois ans du pain et des condiments dans sa région. Pascaline s’approvisionne dans sa région. C’est la première fois que Pascaline et les autres membres du groupement MISSESSIN IV sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de développer d'autre activités plus rentables.
texts.en:
MISSESSIN Iv is a group of fourteen people who all live in the same district of Benin. The group’s representative is Pascaline, age 32, seen in the photo with her hand raised. Pascaline is married to a farmer named Arnaud, and the couple have four children. Two of the children are still in their care, and some of them have received schooling. 

Pascaline never went to school. She lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, Pascaline has been selling bread and condiments locally for the past three years. She buys her stock locally as well. 

This is the first time that Pascaline and the other group members are seeking financial support from ALIDé to help develop more profitable activities.

loans.use: to buy bread and condiments.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. She has three children and has been doing this work for 23 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Marketing milk." Her biggest challenges are "selling the milk and unstable prices." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Kairitu and Fergason both are cows."

Milka was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "For better loan interest."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Groups has helped farmers acquire assets."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, "How will this loan benefit her family," Milka replied, that it "will pay fees for the children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Milka owns the following: "cow, poultry," but does not own "pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower does not have "mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ikatu Group

texts.es:
Ikatu (nombre en guaraní que quiere decir se puede) está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde las integrantes se unieron con el objetivo de poder ayudar a sus familias y darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es Pabla, quien se dedica a hacer artesanías, ella es una persona muy talentosa, y sus clientes siempre quedan muy conformes con el trabajo que ella les hace. Por medio de las artesanías que hace su familia esta recibiendo los ingresos que necesitan para poder seguir creciendo. Quiere seguir trabajando e invirtiendo en sus artesanías, y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar hilos, pinturas, pinceles y demás y así seguir con su trabajo, mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
“Ikatu” (a Guaraní term that means “it can be done”) is in cycle #9 in the women’s committee program.  The members joined together aiming at being able to help their families and to give them everything they themselves were unable to have.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey to get to know each of their situations.

One of the members is Pabla who works making crafts.  She’s a very talented person and her customers are always very satisfied with the work she does for them.  Her family gets income needed to continue growing by means of the crafts she makes.  She wants to continue working and investing in her crafts to continue helping her family this way. 

She’s asking for this loan to buy thread, paint, brushes and others to continue with her work, to improve her income and to continue working.

loans.use: to buy art supplies.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es: Eloy, de 40 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su hijo en una casa alquilada. Para mantener el bienestar de su familia, trabaja con mucho esfuerzo comenta que todos los días se tiene que multiplicar para poder abastecer sus actividades. Durante las mañanas dedica su tiempo al trabajo de construcción en empresas de construcción reconocidas, donde trabaja por cada tiempo de contrato, ya por las tardes dedica su tiempo al cuidado de sus cultivos, los que consiste en cítricos, maíz y yuca, afirma que ya no desea sembrar café, pues este año tuvo muchas pérdidas, pero como es un hombre responsable siempre tienes siembras alternativas. Los terrenos que posee son propios, pues los heredó de sus padres. Ahora se encuentra en la cosecha de mandarina, ya que junto a su tía acopian los frutos para distribuirlos en todo el país, es por esa razón que la va muy bien en su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos, por ello promete ser puntual con sus pagos. Eloy, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Eloy is a 40 year old responsible man.  He lives with his son in rented house.  In order to maintain his family’s well-being, he works every day with great effort.  In the mornings he works for construction companies under contract, and in the evenings he cares for his crops, consisting of citrus, corn, and yucca.  He says that he no longer wants to raise coffee, because he had too many losses, but since he is a responsible man, he has alternate crops.

He has his own farmland, which he inherited from his parents.  Now is the mandarin orange harvest season, and he and his aunt stock the fruit so that it can be distributed throughout the country.  Things are going well in his business for this reason.

This will be his first Kiva loan, and he feels happy and developed because he will be able to continue with his plans.  He also promises to be on time with his payments.  Eloy will use the S/ 1,000 money to buy compost for his crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora, de 60 años, está casada con Sebastian, ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años, está trabajadora mujer tuvo una excelente idea. Cada día pasaba frente a la catarata más reconocida del Perú “Tirol”, y pensó que podía poner un negocio de venta de artesanía y dulces ; es entonces que reunió todas sus fuerzas en construir una choza pequeña, pero adornada con motivos de la localidad. Por mucho tiempo tuvo buenas ganancias, “yo bauticé la catarata con negocio, pero después apareció la competencia”, afirma. Pero como ya es conocida, Teodora, aún sigue deleitando a los visitantes, con cocos, golosinas, cervezas. Ahora, a pesar de los problemas que tiene en la rodilla, ella quiere dar un paso más, pues está planeando abrir una tienda más grande y acogedora. Este es su tercer crédito con KIVA, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos, por ello promete ser puntual con sus pagos. Por ello con los S/.300 soles del préstamo ha pensado comprar materiales para realizar crear sus artesanías.
texts.en:
Teodora, 60, is married to Sebastian and they have 9 children but only 2 children live with them in their own home. For 15 years she has been a hardworking woman who had an excellent idea. Every day she would pass by a famous waterfall in Peru, "Tirol" and she thought she could set up a crafts and sweets business there. This is when she joined forces in building a small hut adorned with local motifs. For a long time she had good earnings, “I baptized the waterfall with business, but later competition appeared”, she says. As she is already well-known, Teodora, still continues attracting visitors with coconuts, sweets, and beer. 

Now, in spite of the problems that she has with her knee, she wants to take her business a step further. She is planning on opening a bigger and more welcoming store. 

This is her third credit with KIVA where she feels strong and happy, since she hopes to obtain the loan to continue with her goals. She promises to be punctual with her payments. 

With the loan of 300 Peruvian Soles she is thinking of buying materials to make her handicrafts.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make her handicrafts.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: Porfirio, a sus 49 años de edad es padre de tres hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Nació y creció en el campo, donde sus padres le enseñaron todas las actividades de la agricultura. Gracias a ello, hoy en día posee ganado y cultivos de naranja, en una finca que heredó de sus padres, además aprovecha la ventaja de estar ubicado a orillas del río Magdalena, pues también se desempeña como pescador para complementar los ingresos familiares. El cliente es un hombre pujante, activo, trabajador y siempre va en busca de mejores opciones que le ayuden a salir adelante. Solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (semillas, riegos, fertilizantes, pesticidas) pues desea utilizar el terreno que tiene disponible para sembrar alrededor de 2 hectáreas de plátano, con lo cual podrá incrementar su producción y diversificar los alimentos y productos que ofrece en el mercado, así mejorará notablemente la entrada de recursos económicos y podrá seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su principal objetivo que es hacer de su finca una gran unidad productiva, con ganado, cerdos, cultivos y pastos fértiles para así seguir velando por el bienestar y la calidad de vida que desea ofrecer a su familia.
texts.en:
Porfirio, who is 49 years old, is the father of three children and is in a common law marriage with his partner. He was born and raised in the country, where his parents taught him everything about agriculture. Thanks to them, he now owns cattle and an orange grove on a farm that he inherited from his parents. He enjoys the benefit of being located near the shores of the Magdalena river because he can work as a fisherman to further contribute to his family's income.

Porfirio is a thriving, active, hardworking man, and is always searching for the best options that will allow him to bring his family forward. He requests this loan with the goal of investing it in the purchase of agricultural supplies in bulk (seeds, irrigation, fertilizers, pesticides). 

He would like to use his available land to plant about 2 hectares of banana plants, which will increase his production, as well as diversify his nutrition and the products that he offers in the market. This will notably increase his economic resources and will allow him to continue to move toward achieving his main goal, which is to make his farm a large, productive entity with cattle, pigs, crops, and fertile pastures to continue to secure his family's well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in bulk (seeds, irrigation, fertilizers, pesticides).

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Beatrice is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provision lick rice, milk, tomatoes, and bottled water in Asafa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 20 years. Beatrice is married and has six children. Her husband is a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Beatrice will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is 38 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have five children. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production: they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Zilpa

texts.en:
Zilpa operates a cereal-selling business. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. In addition she also does farming, which earns her another source of income. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, maize, and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale shop in the future and she appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, maize, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Rosula Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual inicio con mucho esfuerzo su negocio de venta de abarrotes,  Petronila trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar; Petronila cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y ofrece productos a precios cómodos.

Petronila está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio, con lo cual podrá abastecer su bodega y atender de mejor manera a sus clientes, así ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Apoyar a su familia a salir adelante”.
texts.en:
Petronila is a very hardworking woman who started her grocery store business with much effort.  She works about 10 hours daily and is able to cover her household expenses with the fruits of her labor.  Petronila believes she does well in business because she’s kind to her customers and sells goods at affordable prices.

Petronila is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided she will be able to buy merchandise for her business to stock her store and provide better customer service.  She will thus continue working to make her great dream reality: to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of five women who are in the sale of beans, gari (processed cassava), underwear, fish, detergents, and dyes. Beatrice is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs and she was born in Teshie-Accra city in the coastal region of Ghana, 52 years ago. She is married to a fire-service man, and the couple has three children who are attending primary and secondary school. 

For 10 years now, Beatrice has been selling beans, gari, and plantains. This is the sixth loan cycle that Beatrice and her group members have applied for from ID-Ghana. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve upon their living conditions. 

They would need a total amount of GHS 2,900 and Beatrice will use her share of the loan (GHS 900) to expand her business. She will buy one bag of beans and one bag of gari and plantains to resell.

loans.use: To buy one bag of beans and one bag of gari and plantains to resell.

loans.name: Nola Josefina

texts.es: Nola, a sus 37 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja sentimental. Toda su vida productiva la ha dedicado a trabajar como comerciante independiente. Inició con una farmacia ubicada en su pueblo natal, en el departamento de la Guajira, pero, desde hace 5 años se trasladó a la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades de estudio para sus hijos; por lo que tuvo que vender su negocio y con el dinero que obtuvo, compró una salsamentaria ubicada cerca a la casa donde reside actualmente. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6:30 am y hasta las 10:00 pm, para aprovechar las ventajas que posee, pues el negocio está muy bien ubicado y tiene mucha trayectoria en el sector, por lo que ya es reconocido por la comunidad, gracias a lo cual ha generado buenos ingresos para el sustento familiar. La cliente es una mujer luchadora, pujante, activa y perseverante. Solicita el crédito con el ánimo de invertirlo en la compra de una moto para realizar los domicilios de una manera más ágil y oportuna, así  podrá ahorrar mucho tiempo productivo, que en otras palabras significa ganancia para su negocio, podrá atraer más clientes y así aumentar los ingresos que recibe para su familia. Nola sueña con fortalecer y acreditar su negocio para que le genere una estabilidad económica que le ayude a ahorrar para comprar una vivienda propia en la ciudad donde reside y así ofrecer mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Nola, 37, is mother of two children.  She and her husband are in a common law relationship.  She’s spent her entire productive life working as an independent merchant.  She started out with a pharmacy in the town of her birth in La Guajira Department but five years ago moved to the city seeking better school opportunities for her children.  

She had to sell her business and used the money she got to buy a deli located near the house she lives in now.  She works every day from 6:30am until 10pm to take advantage of her sales because the business is very well-located and has a long history in the sector so it’s already well-known in the community.  Thanks to this, it produces good income for family support.

She’s a hardworking, driven, active and perseverant woman.  She’s asking for the loan in order to buy a motorcycle to make home deliveries in a more efficient and timely way.  This will save her much productive time which in other words means more profits for her business.  She will be able to attract more customers thus earning more income for her family.

Nola dreams with strengthening and accrediting the business so that it will generate economic stability that will help her save to buy a house of her own in the city where she lives and thus offer better well-being and quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to do home deliveries.

loans.name: Eduvigis

texts.es: Eduvigis, de 42 años está casada con Fredy y tiene una hija de 8 años con quienes vive en su casa propia. La principal actividad de esta talentosa mujer es, la agricultura, donde siembra una variedad de cítricos; en todo estos años de dedicarse al cuidado de sus cultivos, logró obtener muchas ganancias; ya que no solo comercializa sus cosechas en la zona, también lleva a diferentes lugares del Perú mediante sus intermediarios. Pero conocedora del potencial turístico de la catarata,” Tirol”, ella hace poco instaló un negocio de venta de artesanía típica del lugar, como también una variedad de bebidas, que por el calor del lugar, tiene mucha demanda, según cuenta en temporadas de excursión estudiantil, los alumnos de las diferentes escuelas del Perú, comprar casi toda la mercadería que tiene. Es por ello que visionando el movimiento del lugar, ella desea comprar un terreno amplio, para construir un recreo turístico. Este es su tercer crédito con KIVA, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos, por ello promete ser puntual con sus pagos. Eduvigis, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Eduvigis, 42, is married to Fredy and they have an 8-year-old daughter; she lives with them in her own house.  This talented woman’s main activity is agriculture.  She grows a variety of citrus fruit.  In all these years of caring for her crops she’s earned much profit because she doesn’t just sell her crops in locally but also takes them to various parts of Peru by means of her middlemen.

However, well-aware of the tourist attraction that the “Tirol” waterfall is she opened a crafts store recently selling traditional local crafts.  She also sells a variety of beverages which are in high demand because of the hot temperatures in that place.  According to her, during school field trip season students from various Peruvian schools buy just about everything she has.  This is why in view of the movement in the place she wants to buy a spacious piece of land to build a tourist campground.

This is her third Kiva loan and she feels fulfilled and happy because she hopes to get the loan to continue with her goals.  She promises therefore to be punctual with her payments.  Eduvigis will use the 1,000 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Jennifer did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Jennifer sells second-hand cloth in Asafa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 23 years. As a single mother with 1 child, Jennifer uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Jennefa will use this loan to purchase an increased amount of second-hand clothes, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Jennifer wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that her child is able to receive an education.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Faustina is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cosmetics like body cream and spray and powder in Asafa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 5 years. 

Faustina is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Faustina will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of cosmetics such as body cream and powder, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling smoked and fried fish in Asafa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 6 years. 

Elizabeth is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Elizabeth wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of smoked fish. In the long term, Elizabeth plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: buy fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en: Jalia is married with two children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through farming. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include the rainy season, which hinders her customers to reach out to her, and defaulters. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 37 years old. He is a father of five, and they all go to school. He has spent most of his years in maize farming.  To better utilize his farming he has requested a Kiva loan to support labor costs and by fertilizer for maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming Jean Damascene wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with six children, and four of them are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Hamida sells charcoal and firewood at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 13 years. She gets additional income from selling samosa and cassava chips. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bags of charcoal. 

Her major business challenges are transportation, thieves, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a delivery van, so as to reduce transport costs and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, school fees, and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal and bundles of firewood.

loans.name: Missessin Iii Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MISSESSIN III est formé de seize personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Cica Elise est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Cica Elise est âgée de 26 ans, et est mariée à un fondeur nommé Léonard. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Cica Elise n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Cica Elise vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménages sont supportées par Cica Elise et son mari. Pour ce faire, depuis trois ans, Cica Elise vend du maïs dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Cica Elise vend aussi des condiments. Cica Elise achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Cica Elise et les autres membres du groupement MISSESSIN III sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
MISSESSIN Iii is a group of sixteen people who all live in the same district of Benin. The group’s representative is Cica Elise, age 26, seen in the photo with her hand raised. Cica Elise is married to a foundryman named Leonard, and the couple have three dependent children, some of whom have received schooling. 

Cica Elise never went to school. She lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, Cica Elise has been selling maize locally for the past three years. She also sells condiments. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

This is the first time that Cica Elise and the other group members are seeking financial support from ALIDé. This credit will help them to strengthen their activities and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Venantie Valerie

texts.en:
Venantie Valerie is 48 years old. She is the mother of four children, ages between 9 and 19. They all go to schools. 

She has requested a Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production.  She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as high-risk because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Pheneas

texts.en:
Pheneas is 59 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have one child. He has been a maize farmer for more than thirty years. Pheneas has requested a Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer for maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: pay for fertilizer and labor costs

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and all are in school. She takes care of one additional family member. 

She sells cassava chips, samosas, potato chips, biscuits, and other snacks. She sells her products on a retail and wholesale basis. She has been in business for the last 15 years. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 700,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, baking flour, cheese, and packing bags. Her major business challenges are electricity, lack of enough market, and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to get more space in her stall so as to serve more customers. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour, cooking oil, cheese, and packing bags.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is married and has two children.  Both her children go to school.  Jalia has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 3 years. She also generates additional income through farming.  Jalia has applied for a loan of 500000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. 

Jalia works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges includes the rainy season, which hinders her customers to reach out to her, and defaulters. She aspires of becoming a wholesaler and also to get enough profits to build her own house. 

Jalia resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man and has children.  He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

David operates a business selling printing papers, ink, and pens to passersby and neighbours. In addition he runs a boda boda business as his other source of income.  He cited seasonality and theft as a challenge in his business. 

With this KSH 50,000, David wants to purchase printing papers, inks, pens and other items to sell.  He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his  business.

loans.use: buy office products to sell

loans.name: Mwanamjaka

texts.en:
Mwanamjaka operates a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting Mwanamjaka wants to purchase 8 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates for the support given.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Kimete

texts.en:
Kimete is 47 years old, and she lives in the southern part of Kosovo.  She is the mother of four adult children. She and her husband live with one of their sons and his wife.  Kimete is a housewife, and her husband works in a call center, together with the son and daughter-in-law who they live with.  

The house where they live has another floor that the son and his wife would like to fix up so they can live there with some privacy and start their own family. This would make the living arrangements more comfortable and provide them with their own space to raise children. The renovations that are needed include flooring and doors and windows. 

Kimete is very grateful for this opportunity, and she wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To renovate flooring and doors and windows

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр позитивный и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 48 лет. Он женат и имеет четверо детей. Он очень любит свою семью, особенно своих детей. Он гордится своими детьми и делает всё возможное для них, чтобы они росли и развивались, как и другие дети. Двоих старших дочерей Бахтиёр уже отдал замуж, а сын и ещё одна дочка сейчас живут пока в родительском доме вместе с ними. Бахтиёр живёт со своей семьёй отдельно от своих родителей, в своём собственном доме. Уже более 7 лет Бахтиёр сотрудничает с Арванд, он получал кредит на удовлетворение личных нужд. Также он является добросовестным клиентом, так как ответственно и своевременно производит погашение. Сам Бахтиёр работает водителем, от этого дела у него есть дополнительный доход. Но своё основное время он тратит на развитие своего бизнеса- животноводства.  Он очень любит это дело, так как с юности помогал своему отцу разводить скот и ухаживать за ними. На сегодня у него имеется несколько голов скота, но он желает увеличить поголовье своего скота, чтобы расширить свой бизнес и получать больше дохода на нужды своей семьи. Сейчас Бахтиёр обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота для расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor is a positive and energetic 48 year old man. He is married and has four children. He loves his family very much, especially his children.  Bakhtiyor is proud of his children and does everything to make sure that they grow and develop on par with other kids. Bakhtiyor's two older daughters have already married, but his son and one more daughter still live at home.  The family lives separate from Bakhtiyor's parents, in their own house.  Bakhtiyor has been working with Arvand for seven years and has taken out loans for personal reasons. He is a dependable client who always repays his debt on time.  Bakhtiyor works as a driver and earns additional profits from this business, but his primary occupation is raising livestock. He loves working with animals and has learned how to grow and take care of livestock in his youth from his father. Currently, Bakhtiyor owns several heads of cattle but he wants to expand and purchase a few more animals, so that he can better provide for his family. He has turned to Arvand for a loan which he will use to purchase cattle and expand his business.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita, de 57 años, está casada con Zenón, de 56 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia. A pesar de que hace poco, se restableció de una enfermedad, está valerosa mujer continua dedicándose a la venta de comidas regionales frente a una catarata de su localidad, ella sale a comercializar desde muy tempranas horas del día. Pero como sabe que no todos los días visitan el lugar turístico, Felicita, en la puerta de su casa coloca sillas y mesas para vender más comidas regionales. Por su excelente sazón, ella está pensando abrir un restaurante turístico, donde pueda cocinar con mayor comodidad. Este es su tercer crédito con KIVA, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos, por ello promete ser puntual con sus pagos. Con los S/.500 soles va a comprar ingredientes como sacos de fideos, azúcar, hojas de plátamo y demás comestibles para el preparado de comida.
texts.en:
Felicita, 57, is married to Zenón, 56.  They have five children together but only three of them still live with them in her own house.  Despite recovering from an illness recently, this brave woman continues selling regional food in front of a local waterfall.  She heads out to sell starting very early in the day.  

But since the tourist attraction doesn’t get visitors every day she sets up tables and chairs in front of her doorway to sell more regional food.  Because of her tasty cooking, she’s thinking about opening a tourist restaurant where she can cook more comfortably.

This is her third Kiva loan and she feels very fulfilled and happy because she hopes to get the loan to continue towards her objectives.  She promises to be punctual with her payments then.  She will use the 500 soles to buy ingredients like sacks of noodles, sugar, banana leaves and to food items to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose, de 42 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres, donde vive desde que nació. Desde pequeño aprendió todo lo necesario para seguir con el trabajo de sus padres, la agricultura. Confiesa que aún no deja esa actividad económica que hasta el día de hoy le brinda lo necesario para cubrir algunos gastos. Pero cuando formó su familia, pensó en ahorrar apara el futuro y seguir invirtiendo por ello junto a uno socios empezó a dedicarse a la compra y venta de autos de diferentes marcas y precios; que es su principal actividad económica, “al principio fue muy difícil pero conforme pasaron los años aprendí mucho y ahora trabajo solo y obtengo más ganancias, pues tengo mi propio capital de trabajo”, comenta. El principal factor para su éxito comenta que fue la administración de sus negocios, “sin mezclar”, comenta entre risas. Ahora puso una fábrica de cueros, donde espera poder vender mucho cuero a los fabricantes de ropa.   
Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues trabaja con mucho esmero y en todo este tiempo de trabajo con su banco comunal demostró ser responsable y solidaría. 
José, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en completar el dinero para la compra de un nuevo auto.
texts.en:
José, 42, is a responsible man. He lives with his 2 children in the house that he inherited from his parents, where he has lives since he was born. Since he was young he learned everything necessary to continue with his parents' work, agriculture. He confesses that he has not yet left this economic activity which until now has provided him the opportunity to cover some expenses. 

When he had his family, he thought about saving for the future and to continue investing for it. Together with some partners he began buying and selling cars of different brands and prices; which is his main economic activity. “At the beginning it was very difficult but as the years passed I learned a lot and now I work alone and obtain more earnings because I have my own working capital,” he says. The main factor for his success he says was the administration of his businesses, “without mixing,” he says laughing. Now he opened a leather factory where he hopes to sell a lot of leather to clothing manufacturers. 

This is his first loan with KIVA. He promises to be punctual with the monthly payment. He works with a lot of care and all his time working with the communal bank he has demonstrated to be responsible and supportive. 

José will invest 3000 Peruvian Soles to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es: Ketty, de 32 años es una mujer amable. Vive en compañía de su esposo con quien tiene una pequeña hija a la que cuidan en la casa de su madre. Gracias a su buena educación y al esfuerzo que día a día realizó para con sus padres, ella aprendió a ser una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, proviene de padres agricultores, ello la incentivó a incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de ropa. “En un inicio comencé vendiendo de casa en casa a los vecinos de la playa, pero poco a poco aumenté mi capital”, afirma. Es así que ahora vende la ropa importada y variada en la ferias de la zona los viernes en San Ramón y los sábados en La Merced, comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio por ello espera con muchas ansias poder mejorar el capital de trabajo para así traer nuevos modelos de ropa, ya que sus clientes desean estar siempre a la “moda”. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos, por ello promete ser puntual con sus pagos. Ketty, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de ropa variada para abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ketty, 32, is a kind woman living with her husband with whom she has a little girl they care for in her mother’s house.  Thanks to her good education and the effort she put in with her parents every day, she learned to be a hardworking, striving woman.  She comes from parents who work in agriculture and that motivated her to go into the business of buying and selling clothes.  “In the beginning I sold house to house to neighbors at the beach and gradually I increased my capital,” she affirms.  Now, she sells assorted, imported clothes in the street markets in San Ramón on Fridays and in La Merced on Saturdays.  She comments that she does very well so she’s anxiously awaiting being able to improve her working capital to bring new styles of clothes because her customers always want to be ‘in style.’  

This is her first Kiva loan and she feels fulfilled and happy because she hopes to get the loan to continue towards her objectives.  Therefore, she promises to be punctual with her payments.  Ketty will use the 1,000 soles to buy assorted clothes to supply her customers.

loans.use: to buy varied clothes.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
Constantina, de 59 años, es una mujer sencilla vive en compañía de su esposo. Con quien vive desde hace 40 años, en la casa que compraron hace 30 años. Juntos forjaron su familia, sus años de esfuerzo y entrega le ayudaron a obtener muchos esfuerzos y logros, tanto así que ahora esperan con tranquilidad la temporada de siembra, pues poseen sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Las cuales comparten con sus hijos. “Ellos también se dedican a la agricultura”, afirma. Ahora se encuentra preparando los terrenos de cultivo, pues comienza la temporada de lluvias por lo que tiene que aprovechar. Pienza sembrar maíz y demás hortalizas, además de forraje y pastos naturales para sus animales.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “pampa blanca” y este es el crédito número 3 con KIVA, donde se siente feliz, ya que tiene muchos años trabajando con su asociación, donde los integrantes son personas, humanas y sobre todo con muchas ganas de ayudarse entre ellos.
Constantina, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de maíz.
texts.en:
Constantina, 59, is an unassuming woman who has been with her husband for 40 years living in the house they bought 30 years ago.  They formed a family together and their years of effort and dedication helped her obtain many goals and efforts.  So much so, that they now peacefully await the planting season for they own their own farmland that they share with their children.  “They work in agriculture, too,” she affirms.

Now, she’s preparing the farmland because the rainy season is about to begin and it must be taken advantage of.  She intends to plant corn and other vegetables and also forage and natural grasses for her animals.

She belongs to the “Pampa Blanca” communal bank and this is loan #3 with Kiva.  She feels happy because she’s been working with her association for many years and the members are humane people who above all want to help each other out.  Constantina will use the 1,000 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her corn crop.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат добродушный и жизнерадостный молодой парень в возрасте 28 лет. Он женат и имеет 3 детей. Но вместе со своей семьёй Шавкат живёт в родительском доме. Шавкат живёт в маленьком сельском посёлке, возле своего дома у него имеется большое поле. После окончания средней школы Шавкат не смог получить высшего образования в связи с финансовыми проблемами в семье. Поэтому с юности он обучался у своего отца сельскому ремеслу. Они также пасли скот на поле возле их дома и от этого получали доход в семью. После того, как Шавкат женился, он решил сам продолжить отцовское дело и взял на себя ответственность за реализацию данного бизнеса, чтобы отец больше не трудился в связи с его здоровьем. Таким образом Шавкат занимается животноводством и желает развивать этот бизнес, чтобы в будущем иметь хороший доход для достойного проживания, а также чтобы обеспечить своих детей всем необходимым и дать им хорошее образование. Сейчас он хочет закупить ещё несколько голов скота, для получения большей прибыли. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Шавкат заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Shavkat is a laid back and cheerful young man of 28. He is married and has three children. Shavkat's family still lives in his parent's house, in a small village next to a large field. After finishing high school Shavkat was not able to attend college, due to his family's financial situation. Instead he learned how to be a farmer from his father. They pasture cattle on the field next to their house and this provides income for the family. After marriage Shavkat decided to continue his father's business and took over the responsibilities for everything, so that his father wouldn't have to work hard and could take care of his health. Thus, Shavkat is raising livestock for a living and wants to expand his business so that in the future he will have enough income for a comfortable life. Also he wants to be able to provide his children with everything necessary and give them a good education. Currently Shavkat plans to buy a few more cows for his herd so that he can make more money. For this reason Shavkat has turned to Arvand and is requesting a loan to purchase the animals. Shavkat is thankful in advance to Arvand for financial assistance.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Jesugnon Group

texts.fr: JESUGNON est un groupe constitué de six personnes qui habitent le même village et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Marguérite. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Marguérite est âgée de 25 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Nestor. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Marguérite vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison.  Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Marguérite vend de l'huile de palme et produit de la farine de manioc qu'elle vend dans sa région depuis près de trois ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Marguérite vend du maïs. Marguérite s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Ce prêt permettra certainement à Marguérite et à son groupe JESUGNON de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Jesugnon is a group made up of six women who live in the same village, whose representative is Marguérite, the lady with her hand raised in the photo. In order to increase their working-capital, this group is making a request for a loan, for the first time, through Alidé. Marguérite is 25 years old and is married to Nestor, a farmer. The couple has four children which are all under their care, some of whom are at school. She lives with her children and her husband, with both adults providing for their household. 

In order to provide for herself and her family, Marguérite sells palm oil and produces cassava flour, which she has been selling locally for almost three years. Alongside this business, she also sells maize. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. This loan will certainly allow Marguérite and her group, Jesugnon, to grow their business, their customer base and their income.

loans.use: to buy cassava and palm oil

loans.name: Federation Investors Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Innocent from Harare. He is widowed with three children, two attending school. He also cares for his parents. He is a member of the Federation Investors Group. Innocent sells potatoes and orange seedlings and fruits. His business has been in operation for 21 years. He says the main challenges sometimes faced are political instability and times when meetings result in business being disturbed. Innocent has requested a loan of $700 to buy more seedlings and fruits for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to finish building his house. In the future Innocent plans to have a nursery of these seedlings at his own farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fruit for resale

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and all her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of Uganda Shillings 800,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of Irish potatoes, boxes of tomatoes, onions, watermelon, pineapples, passion fruits. Her major business challenge is perishability and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to get more space on her stall so as to serve more customers and also to become a wholesaler. 

She lives in rented house; the family has no access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes, boxes of tomatoes, onions, watermelon, passion fruits and pineapples.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  Rehema dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, soap, rice, beans, cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, soap, rice, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase stones for her business.
