Con su primer capital, empezó a elaborar panes, pudines y pequeñas bandejas de productos,  para eventos sociales, como fiestas del día de las madres, cumpleaños, primeras comuniones etc. Hoy en su panadería vende panes, rosquillas, croazan, deditos de queso, entre otros y los vende directamente a su clientela, que está ubicada en la comunidad donde habita. Su horario de trabajo inicia a las 7 de la mañana y termina diariamente (de lunes a domingos), a las 7 de la noche. Su meta mas adelante es mejorar la imagen del local y a nivel de su hogar, aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su mayor desafío, es lograr fuentes de financiamiento y esto es lo que ha conseguido con su credikiva, primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará harina de trigo en mayor volumen, queso, grasas e insumos varios, que aumentarán su capital de trabajo,  sus posibilidades de producir mas y vender mas y esto es justamente el éxito de Kiva.
texts.en:
Jair, 31 years old, lives in a municipality in the metropolitan area of the city.  He lives with his wife and his two children, ages 2 and 8 years.  He has had a bakery there since January of the year 2009.  He decided to start the bakery when he stopped working for other people.

With his seed money, he started to make breads, puddings, and small trays of products for social events like Mother's Day parties, birthdays, first communions, etc.  Today in his bakery, he sells breads, doughnuts, croissants, cheese fingers and other items, which he sells directly to his customers who are located in the community where he lives.

His work schedule starts at 7 in the morning and ends daily (from Monday to Sunday) at 7 at night.  His future goal is to improve the image of the store, and on the home front, to improve his family's quality of life.

His greatest challenge is to find sources of financing, and this is what he has found with his Kiva loan, the first loan he is taking from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy wheat flour in bulk, cheese, oils and various ingredients, which will increase his working capital, his potential to produce more and to sell more.  This is precisely Kiva's success.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour in bulk, cheese, oils and various ingredients.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pequeño hijo y sus padres, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora,que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Maribel no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería.
Por iniciativa propia, Maribel trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, tanto para damas y caballeros, ella trabaja todos todos los días en un mercado de su ciudad y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas.
Maribel se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará una habitación en su vivienda, desea refaccionar el techado y piso de este, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maribel is a 20 year old woman and lives in the city of Chincha with her small son and her parents. She is a single, hard-working mother, who is making every effort to get her family ahead. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Maribel was not able to study to become a nurse. On her own initiative, Maribel works at her own business, selling clothes for both men and women. She works every day in a market in the city and can be there for about 10 hours a day.

Maribel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help offered, she will be able to improve a room in her home. She wants to repair the roof and floor of the room, as well as continue working and striving to achieve her dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Erick Ronald

texts.es:
Erick es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Erick no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia, Erick trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Erick se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara un ropero para su hogar, ya que el y su familia guardan sus prendas de vestir en cajas y desean protegerlos de la humedad, así pues Erick seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Erick is 22 years old, single and lives with his parents and brothers in Ica, within the Parcona district.  He is a hardworking, enthusiastic person with a great desire to succeed.  Unfortunately, Erick was not able to study for a professional management career, due to a lack of resources.

Erick works as a field worker at a farm in town.  He works for about 10 hours a day and feels that things are going well for him because of his efforts and dedication. 

Erick is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and he was able to buy a clothing cabinet for his home, because his family was storing their clothing in boxes and they wanted to protect them from the humidity.  Erick will continue working and making an effort to achieve his dream of studying for a profession.

loans.use: to buy a clothing cabinet.

loans.name: Rubenia Dolores

texts.es:
Rubenia, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar cocos, sodas, golosinas y dulces.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos y aumentaron los ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Rubenia finds herself in a position where she needs a new loan because she requires more capital. This investment will allow her to buy coconuts, sodas, snacks and candy.

The previous loan helped her to improve her income, economic conditions and family situation.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, sodas, snacks and candy.

loans.name: Teta

texts.en:
Teta is 24 years old, married, and lives in Airport in Margibi county which has the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. Her two children, who attend school, live at home and her husband is a contractor. 

For the past 4 years she has been involved in business and currently she sells milk, bread, soft drinks, etc. She says she always uses a taxi to transport her goods to her business. She likes how her customers can buy from her, and she is proud of how supportive she is to her family. She learned this way of selling from her mother. She sells for 10 hours per day from Monday to Saturday. She is requesting a loan to purchase more milk, bread, soft drinks, etc. for her business. 

Her plan is to build her house. She is glad to become a borrower through BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more milk, bread, soft drinks, etc. for her business

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
María Luisa de 50 años, tiene una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 20 años, quien no ha tenido la oportunidad de estudiar; porque le ayuda a su padre a trabajar la tierra y así contribuir con los ingresos familiares.

Tiene aproximadamente 4 años de ser porpietaria de una tienda, es un pequeño negocio que bien administrado puede dar grandes frutos, además se dedica a ser ama de casa.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar productos para la tienda, como azúcar, bebidas gaseosas, granos básicos y demás, pero sobre todo poner venta de recargas electrónicas para celulares, es lo que más le demandan y no tiene disponible.

María, se ha propuesto como meta personal, además de una tienda mucho más grande, comprar un molino de nixtamal para dar servicio de molienda.
texts.en:
María Luisa, age 50, has a store in which she sells basic needs items.  She lives with her husband and her 20 year old son.  Her son has not had the opportunity to go to school because he helps his father work the land and contribute to the family income.

She has had a store for approximately four years.  It is a small business that is well-run and able to produce great income.  She is also a housewife.

The loan will be used to buy products for the store.  She will buy products like sugar, drinks, soft drinks, basic grains, and others.  However, above all else, she will sell electronic recharge cards for cell phones.  This is what is in the most demand, and she does not have them available.  

María has set as a personal goal, in addition to having a much larger store, buying a corn mill in order to provide grinding services.

loans.use: to buy products like sugar, drinks, soft drinks, basic grains, and recharge cards for cell phones.

loans.name: Zakeyah

texts.en:
Zakeyah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo. Zakeyah is a 53-year-old divorced woman from Rafah city. She lives with her brother's family in a small humble home. 

For the past six years, Zakeyah has been working at selling kids' clothes in the local market. It is a good job but with very low and seasonal earnings. 

Zakeyah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more clothes for her store to resell. This will increase her income and also improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her store to resell

loans.name: Hugo Alexander

texts.es:
Hugo de 20 años de edad, es un joven trabajador que solo pudo realizar sus estudios de educación media,  vive con sus padres, pero tiene planeado independizarse porque pronto contraerá matrimonio.

Desde que tenía 12 años trabajo en un taller de estructuras metálicas con un tío, para llegar a dicho lugar se desplazaba 4 km. Desde su casa en bicicleta y trabajaba de 7:00 am a 2:00 pm y por las tardes trabajaba también con su padre en el mismo oficio.

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como: bloques, arena, cemento, grava, también la compra de las instalaciones eléctricas y para el traslado de los materiales desde el lugar de compra hasta donde construirá su casa

Hugo tiene como meta construir su casa, formar una familia y trabajar duro para ver crecer a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hugo, 20, is a young worker who only completed middle school. He lives with his parents but he has plans to become independent because he's getting married soon.

Since he was 12 years old he has worked in a metal shop with his uncle. The distance to this place is 4km from his house by bike. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. and in the afternoons he also worked with his father in the same trade.

This loan would be used to purchase construction material such as blocks, sand, cement, gravel as well as the purchase of electrical installation and the transportation of the materials from the place of purchase to the construction site.

Hugo's goals are to build his house, have a family and work hard to see his children grow up.

loans.use: to purchase construction material such as blocks, sand, cement, gravel and electrical installation.

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es:
Jesus es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Jesus no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica.
Por iniciativa propia, Jesus trabaja como obrero da campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Jesus se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorara su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar el techado, paredes y otros, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jesus is a young man of 21. He lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is a very hard-working and enthusiastic man who is making every effort to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources and the need to work, Jesus was not able to study for a professional career in Mechanical Engineering. On his own initiative, Jesus works as a field hand on an agricultural farm, and he works every day for approximately 10 hours. He believes he is doing well thanks to his dedication and effort.

Jesus is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their support, he will be able to improve his home. He wants to strengthen the roof, walls etc. and he can continue working and striving to achieve his dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Mary from Liberia. Presently, she lives in Airport in Margibi county which has the largest rubber plantation in Liberia. She is unmarried and lives with her four children at home. All of her children are between the ages of 2 and 16, and only three of them are attending school. Her fiancé is a security guard. 

For the past 3 years she has been doing business in the local market. Presently she is selling red oil [palm oil] and charcoal. She started this business with a little money from her fiancé and learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes the flow of her customers and she enjoys the profit she makes sometimes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and charcoal for her business. 

Her dream is to see herself as an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu lives in New Kru town. She is 30 years old and single with two children ages 6 and 8 that are in school and live at home. 

For the past 3 years she has been selling onion, pepper, Vita, and other items. She started this business by selling rice around the community with the few goods she could afford, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more onion, pepper, Vita, and many items for her business. 

Her plan is to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more onion, pepper, Vita, and many items for her business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single young man from Deir Elbalah city. He lives with his family in a very humble home. Mohammad's father is a worker and he gets a low income. He would like to buy a laptop for his son Mohammad but he could not save this amount. Mohammad is a student in the university where he studies business. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a laptop for his study. By applying this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and write reports. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his study

loans.name: Vilma Evelin

texts.es:
Vilma de 27 años de edad, tiene 16 años de vivir con su pareja, con la que ha procreado 5 hijos, de 14, 10, 7, 6 y 2 años de edad debido a que su familia eran de escasos recursos, solo pudo estudiar hasta segundo grado.
Actualmente su pareja se dedica a trabajar la tierra y  en la construcción.

Vilma se dedica a la venta de pan, diariamente camina alrededor de 7 km. En la comunidad para vender su producto, tiene 3 años de realizar dicha actividad que aprendió ella sola, con esto ella contribuye con los ingresos de la familia.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar más producto (pan) a su proveedor, debido a que la demanda es muy grande y muchas veces se queda sin producto antes de terminar el recorrido rutinario, con esto tendrá mayores ingresos y mejorara la calidad de vida de la familia.

Vilma tiene un propósito en su vida y espera lograrlo, ella quiere instalar su propia tienda en la casa, darle a sus hijos oportunidades que ella no tuvo y ayudar a su pareja con la compra de fertilizantes para trabajar la tierra.
texts.en:
Vilma, 27, has been with her partner for 16 years. They have 5 children ages 14, 10, 7, 6 and 2. Because her family was under privileged she was only able to study until second grade.

At the moment her partner works the land and in construction.

Vilma sells bread daily walking around 7 kms in the community to sell her product. She has been doing this work for 3 years which she learned on her own. With this she contributes to the household income.

The loan will be used to buy more product (bread) from her supplier as the demand is very high and she is often left without product before finishing her daily route. With this loan she will have a higher income and improve her family's quality of life.

Vilma has a purpose in her life and hopes to obtain it. She wants to open her own store in her house so that she can give her children opportunities that she didn’t have and to help her partner with the purchase of fertilizer to work the land.

loans.use: to purchase bread and resell the product.

loans.name: Tasi

texts.en:
Tasi is a 54-year-old married woman with 4 children. 

She has a cattle farm where she has raised cows to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Tasi has requested a loan to buy nails and barbed wire to build a wire fence for 10 acres of land. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. With her profits, Tasi hopes to buy more small calves.

loans.use: to buy nails and barbed wire

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Becoming a professional accountant has always been Judith's dream. Judith was accepted into the Universidad Saint Paul and now with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording tuition fees. She plans on graduating in December, 2013 but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. With a loan, Judith plans on purchasing her much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Judith feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. To help afford her school and living expenses, Judith currently works 40 hours a week as a accounting assistant. With a degree in accounting she expects to earn $15 a day. With one older sibling attending college already, Judith is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a multi-talented photographer who incorporates her work with memorable and creative concepts. Her skill and eye for design and art separate her work from others in the Houston area. Just take a look at her website, http://www.veronicastupublicidad.com/p/nuestros-servicios.html, you’ll notice the extent of Veronica’s work. 

Her five years of experience shows within her work. Playing with the balance of tones, colors and black and white elements within a photo helps her make the most of her shoot’s outcome as she directs her team, poses her subjects, edits and finalizes each shoot. However, Veronica doesn’t limit herself to simple photos.

As part of her business, Veronica can create logos, calendars, invitations and photo illustrations, and guarantees effort surpassing her competition. Veronica says about her photography, “For me, it’s an art, my passion and a blessing.” And her passion shows through her work as she views her job as a lifestyle--she works to perfect each project. Veronica states on her website that because of photography: “I have known the magic that holds a smile, a tear, a touch and a glance because I love what I do.” Veronica offers plenty more services.

She ventured to Accion Texas Inc. to obtain a loan to update her equipment and begin offering more services to a larger clientele. After a friend informed her about Accion, the owner of Veronica’s Arte Fotografico y Diseno decided to accept the loan saying her business wouldn’t grow without it.

Check out her most recent work on her Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Veronica-Fotografia/303801119630571/.

loans.use: to update equipment

loans.name: Uriel

texts.en: Uriel is currently attending the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés, working towards his degree in accounting and auditing. He plans on graduating in December, 2013 but without a loan from Vittana he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. Uriel plans on using the loan to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. To help afford his school, Uriel works 30 hours a week but shares that making time to work and go to school has been one of his biggest challenges. With a career in accounting, he expects to earn $20 a day.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, four of whom are in school, Ofelia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Ofelia is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 47 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school.

Rosario works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Rosario has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Rosario aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy additional stocks of household items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Soledad

texts.en:
Blanca has always dreamt of becoming a chef. Blanca was accepted into the Instituto Nueva Bolivia and now with the chance to achieve her dream is concerned about affording graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in culinary arts before graduating.  She plans on graduating in December, 2013 but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

Blanca currently works 30 hours a week as a phone operator and earns $6 a day. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in culinary arts, she expects to earn $25 a day. With one older sibling attending college already, Blanca is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Fruits Group

texts.fr: FRUITS est un groupe de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Tossinmè Jeanne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Tossinmè Jeanne est âgée de 48 ans et vit au Bénin. Tossinmè Jeanne est mariée à Sylvère, un mécanicien. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Tossinmè Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Pour contribuer aux diverses charges, Tossinmè Jeanne vend depuis douze ans environ des fruits et des légumes dans sa région. Tossinmè Jeanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Tossinmè Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FRUITS, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
"Fruits" is a group of three women who live in the same neighbourhood.  This is the first time that this group have requested a loan from the field partner Alidé.  The loan will be used to increase the size of their businesses.  

The group representative is Tossinmè Jeanne, and is in seen the centre of the photo with her hand raised.  Tossinmè Jeanne is 48 years old and lives in Benin.  She is married to Sylvère who is a mechanic.  The couple have three children who are all in school and who are all still under their care.  Tossinmè Jeanne lives with her husband and their children, and, together the couple provide for the needs of their household.  To help with this, she has sold fruit and vegetables in her region for about twelve years.  She buys her stocks at a market in Benin.  Tossinmè Jeanne will use this loan to respond to the demands of her customers and increase her business and income.

Along with the other members of the Fruits group, Tossinmè Jeanne is requesting her first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr:
Née vers 1969 à KOLOMINA, HABY vit avec ses trois enfants et son époux dans une  famille traditionnelle dans le quartier LAFIABOUGOU de la ville de SELINGUE. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite HABY s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des habits en provenance de BAMAKO et des pagnes wax de Lomé (au Togo).    
HABY est à son deuxième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  50 pièces de pagnes wax  auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, au marché et dans les foires  environnantes (de KANGARE)  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
HABY espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1969 in Kolomina, Haby lives, with her husband and three children, in a traditional family in the Lafiabougou district of the town of Selingue.  Being unable to continue with her studies, Haby quickly became interested in money-making activities, notably in buying and selling clothes from Bamako and wax pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing) from Lomé, in Togo.  This will be Haby's second loan from the field partner Soro Yiriwaso, and it will be used to buy 50 wax pagnes from wholesalers.

Haby makes cash, credit and retail sales from her home, at the market and at fairs local to Kangare.  Her customers are both men and women.  Haby hopes to make a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which will be used to help her husband with the financial needs of their family, to repay the loan and to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Norcamar

texts.en:
Norcamar is 33 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. Norcamar is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Norcamar has been farming coconuts for nine years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn is 36 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Erlyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers.

Erlyn has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purches rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Sherlita works hard to support her family.

She has a 'buy and sell' rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store and raising pigs. Sherlita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Sherlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Tsogt-Erdene

texts.en: Mr. Tsogt-Erdene, 28 years old, lives with his wife and son in a house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He began rendering taxi service to local people in 2012 and before this he worked in Korea on a two-year employment contract. His wife and son are currently staying at home. In October, their son will begin to go to kindergarten. His wife has plan of studying at the university and for this reason, he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to pay her tuition fees. After graduating from her school, his wife would be able to find a job, thus improving their living standard.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Abou

texts.fr: Monsieur ABOU, âgé de 28 ans, est un commerçant qui exerce le métier depuis 10 ans déjà. Il fait de la vente de produits électroniques divers. Il sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises et satisfaire sa clientèle. ABOU commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. ABOU est marié et père de 2 enfants dont le plus âgé a 4 ans et le cadet 1 ans. Il s’occupe des besoins familiaux. Le crédit va impacter sur  la situation du client car il va voir son stock augmenter. Comme projet futur : il veut acquérir d'un grand magasin afin de pouvoir augmenter ses sources de revenu. Et ce projet, il désire le voir se réaliser avec l’appui des préteurs.
texts.en:
Abou, 28 years old, has been a shopkeeper for 10 years already. He is in the business of reselling various electronics items. He is requesting this loan to increase his stock of merchandise and to satisfy his customers. Abou begins his days at 9am and finishes at 7pm. He is married and the father of two children, ages 4 and 1. Abou is responsible for the family's needs.

This loan will affect Abou's current situation because he will be able to increase his stock. In the future, he would like to acquire a larger store in order to increase his profits. He is hoping to accomplish this himself with the support of lenders.

loans.use: to purchase electronics items like radios and televisions to resell

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des produits vivriers pour son activité(revendeuse de nourriture), madame Akou sollicite son troisième crédit à WAGES. Les deux derniers ont été payés sans aucune difficulté. Elle espère agrandir son activité tout en contribuant aux besoins de la famille. Âgée de 43ans, elle a pour conjoint un maitre tailleur et mère de famille.
texts.en:
Akou is 43 years old. She is married with children, and her husband is a tailor. 

Akou sells foodstuffs, and she is seeking a 3rd loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. Both past loans were repaid without difficulty. 

She wants to expand her business and help to provide for the needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin tiene 28 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Totorani en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la agricultura y el engorde de ganado, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Colque Orcco” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar alimentos concentrados como forrajes y pastos para el engorde de ganado, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Martin, 28, lives in the community of Totorani in Paucartambo. He is a hard working and entrepreneurial person who supports his family with the strength of his work. He works in agriculture raising cattle. 

He is a responsible person and as such, was invited to participate in the community bank Colque Orcco. This time, he is requesting a loan to buy concentrated feed like fodder and grass to fatten up the cattle. He appreciates and values ​​the loan and is committed to paying his monthly dues with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed like fodder and grass to fatten up the cattle.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia tiene 55 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de verduras, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo papas, cebollas, zanahorias, tomates y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Eusebia is 55 years old and lives in the community of Sunchubamba, which is in Paucartambo Province. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who wants to move her family forward. Through her work efforts, she manages a business of selling vegetables.  Eusebia is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Tres Cruces de Oro” (Three Crosses of Gold). 

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy inventory such as potatoes, onions, carrots, tomatoes, and other types of produce.  Eusebia appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, carrots, tomatoes, and other types of produce.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo para invertir más en el negocio de venta de mariscos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar pescado, camarón, conchas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar su negocio, asimismo aumentaron sus ventas e incremento la clientela, también adquirió un puesto en el mercado; es por ello que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: José is seeking a new loan to invest in in seafood selling business.  This investment will help him to purchase fish, shrimp, shellfish and others.  The previous loan helped him to improve his business, increasing his sales and client base; he was also able to acquire a stall in the market.  Due to the loan, his family's financial situation has improved.

loans.use: purchase fish, shrimp, shellfish, etc...

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 6 personas emprendedoras y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “SOL NACIENTE”.La Sra. Gladys de 47 años de edad  y madre de  1 hijo, ella se dedica hace 7 años  a la venta de desayunos en un pequeño mercado.  La Sra. Gladys nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus desayunos y así  obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más  productos como (café, azúcar, tasas, platos, cubiertos  etc.) y  así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Gladys y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva y Edaprospo por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Gladys se encuentra sentada en el medio se le distingue por su casaca negra, se despide Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
The "SOL NACIENTE" [Rising Sun] communal bank is made up of 6 entrepreneurs who have a lot of creativity in their businesses. Gladys is 47 years old and has one son. For 7 years she has been selling breakfasts in a small market. Gladys says she has developed a loyal clientele which has given her enough profits to cover the household running costs. In the future she would like to have a place of her own where she can sell her breakfasts and so make better profits.

She will use the loan provided to buy more products such as coffee, sugar, cups, plates, cutlery etc. so she can make progress with her business. At the same time Gladys and all of the group members are grateful to Kiva and EDAPROSPO for the loan provided and for the confidence shown in them. 

Gladys is seated in the middle wearing a black jacket. She signs off with the promise that she will meet all of her proposed payments.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar and cutlery.

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Ankhbayar, 37 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a security officer at a private firm for seven years. His wife has the position of sales manager at a chain store. Both of their children go to high school. 

Over the years, his house has deteriorated and this summer he began making renovations on his house, but due to lack of finance he didn't finish it. So he is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase vacuum insulated windows, an iron door, hardwood floor, bricks, and fiberglass. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Las Manitos De Jesús Group

texts.es: La Sra. Ana es casada tiene  4 hijos, de los cuales uno dependen de ella. Ana se  dedica  a  la  venta  de  productos  de belleza. Comenzó por medio de sus vecinos  y  amistades quienes  le incentivaron a  dedicarse  a  este  negocio. También se dedica la  venta de comida y  tejidos de lentejuelas. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo Ana   ha  logrado  salir adelante. Ella  ayuda a su  esposo  en los  gastos de su hogar. Su anhelo para el futuro es construir  su casa y que sus hijo  estudie una carrera universitaria. Ella usara el préstamo para la compra de productos de belleza. Ana pertenece a la alcancía comunal Las Manitos de Jesús”, el cual está conformado por 7 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta, ella es la persona que se encuentra de pie en el grupo. La Sra. Ana  es la persona que se encuentra de pie con una chompa de color marron al costado de las otras señoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana is married and has four children, but only one is dependent on her.  She sells beauty products and started this business after being encouraged by her neighbors and friends.  Ana also sells food and sequined fabrics.  Through her effort and work, Ana is able to get ahead.  She has the help of her husband in covering the household expenses.  Her wish for the future is to build a house and to see her child pursue a university degree.  

Ana will use her loan to buy beauty products.  Ana is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Manitos de Jesús” (The Little Hands of Jesus), which consists of seven people and is led by a president, one of the individuals who is standing.  

Sra. Ana is the woman who is standing with the other ladies on either side of her and is wearing a brown sweater.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Earika

texts.en:
Earika is from Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental and a fourth year student of Misamis University, taking up Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. 

She needs to finish her studies to have a better profession for her future. She borrowed a loan of 14,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester. She is hopeful that in the future, she would find a job that fits her qualification.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 54-year-old married woman with one child and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Ruth manages a gardening business and earns 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Her previous loans that she used for the farm inputs were successfully repaid. 

Aside from her garden, she also started her general store to earn more income for a living. Recently, she requested a loan of 15,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase additional goods like canned goods, sachet products and biscuits. 

In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like canned goods, sachet products, and biscuits

loans.name: Flocerfida

texts.en:
This is Flocerfida, 63, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Aniceto, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Flocerfida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php10,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Flocerfida dreams of expanding her business and hopes to help others.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Las Abejas Reinas Group

texts.es: Jose Luis, quien en la fotografía aparece agachado, de sweater azul y con su mano en el mentón, es socio del Banco Comunal Las Abejas Reinas, que está ubicado en Villarrica en la provincia de Catín,  IX Región de Chile. Algunos de los rubros de este Banco Comunal son taxista, venta de ropa y masajista. Jose Luis vende ropa, hace 4 meses, y comenzó a hacerlo ya que un día viajó a Santiago y tenía un poco de dinero decidió probar suerte compro un poco de ropa y le fue muy bien vendiéndola en Villarrica, así que decidió comenzar a hacerlo. No ha tenido grandes problemas, ya que también tiene un trabajo estable, solo le ha pasado que algunos clientes no le han pagado en la fecha pactada. El dinero que solicita lo ocupará para comprar más ropa. Cree que le irá muy bien en la venta de ropa ya que se ha hecho de clientes, los cuales le han solicitado más ropa. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar es tener la oportunidad de encontrar personas con sus mismos intereses de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jose Luis appears in the photograph in a crouched position, wearing a blue sweater, and with his hand on his chin. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Abejas Reinas” (The Queen Bees), a group that is located in Villarrica in the province of Catín, Region 9 of Chile. Some members of this Communal Bank are taxi drivers, sell clothes, or practice massage therapy.

Jose Luis has been selling clothes for four months. He started his business one day by traveling to Santiago with a little bit of money. Jose Luis decided to try his luck by purchasing a few clothes and did very well selling them in Villarrica, which resulted in the start of his business. He has not experienced any huge problems since he also has a stable job, but his only concern is that he has had a few customers who have not paid on the agreed due date.

The money he is requesting will be used to buy more clothes. He believes he will do very well with selling clothes since he already has customers who are requesting more of his merchandise. What he enjoys most about this work is that he gets the opportunity to meet people who have the same interests in getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Remita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Remita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming coconut.  Remita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy and sell fish business.

Remita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Diladis

texts.es: Diladis de 62 años de edad habita en un municipio, área metropolitana de la ciudad. Ella es una mujer cada que tiene 5 hijos adultos, los cuales ha sacado adelante con su cónyuge, mediante su trabajo en un pequeño negocio, ubicado donde habita. Desde hace 20 años, inició su idea emprendedora, vendiendo ropa y accesorios femeninos; poco a poco su negocio creció y hoy desea una vez mas, incrementar sus ventas y aumentar el volumen de su clientela, pero su mayor desafío,  es obtener una buena fuente de financiación para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mari Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará jeans, blusas, aretes, cadenas de fantasía etc. Con esta inversión aumentarán sus inventarios y podrá vender mucho más y esto es justamente la razón de éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Diladis is 62 years old and lives in a municipality, in a metropolitan area of the city. She is a woman that has 5 adult children, which with her husband have moved forward in life, though her work in a small business, located where she lives. Twenty years ago, she began her entrepreneurial idea, selling clothes and women's accessories. Little by little her business grew and today she wants again to increase her sales and expand the number of her customers, but her greatest challenge, is to obtain a good source of financing to achieve it. This is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first financing from Fundación Mari Santo Domingo, though which she will buy jeans, blouses, earrings, costume jewelry etc. With this investment she will increase her inventory and be able to sell much more which is precisely the reason for the success of the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy jeans, blouses, earrings, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, egg, etc. for her general store business. Neneth has been in this business for 5 years. Neneth earns additional income from farming/selling vegetables.

Neneth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, eggs, etc.

loans.name: José María

texts.es: José, a sus 53 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado al transporte de personas, inició trabajando como ayudante en un chivero y poco a poco fue aprendiendo a conducir; luego trabajó como conductor de varias personas de la región y en algunas minas de la región. Actualmente se dedica a transportar estudiantes de colegios y personas en general, de esta manera ha generado los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. El cliente es un hombre trabajador, noble y humilde, lucha incansablemente para dar lo mejor a su familia y por ello ha sobrepasado diversos inconvenientes, especialmente con el carro, pues las vías están en mal estado y han deteriorado mucho su vehículo, lo que ha hecho que gaste mucho dinero en la reparación, desestabilizando la economía de su hogar, sin embargo, ha encontrado la forma de continuar con su labor. El crédito que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de nuevos ejes y realizar mantenimiento de latonería, con esto el carro quedará más alto y, así evitará que se dañe constantemente,  además tendrá mejor imagen y ofrecerá mejor seguridad a sus pasajeros, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus contratos, lo que significa mayor nivel de ingresos económicos para continuar solventando las necesidades de su hogar y avanzar cada día para que en un futuro cercano, pueda cumplir el sueño de adquirir otro vehículo con el que pueda incrementar el patrimonio familiar y dar a su familia mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old, a father of 3 children and lives in a common-law marriage.  Throughout his career, he has worked in transportation.  He started out as an assistant on a bus, and little by little he learned to drive.  Later, he worked as a driver for various people and in some of the mines in the region.  Currently, he transports students and other people, which has allowed him to generate the necessary income to afford his basic household necessities.  

The client is a hardworking, noble and humble man who fights tirelessly to give his family the best and because of this, he has overcome many inconveniences, especially with his car since the roads are in poor conditions and have greatly deteriorated his vehicle.  This has caused him to spend a lot of money repairing his car, destabilizing his household finances.  Nevertheless, he has found ways to continue with his work.

The loan he is seeking will be invested in the purchase of new axles and to perform autobody maintenance which will raise the car to avoid the constant damage.  It will also make the car look better and be safer for his passengers which will be demonstrated by his increased clientele.  This will lead to increased income to continue to afford his household expenses and advance everyday so that in the near future, he will be able to realize his dream of owning another car with which he can increase his family's assets and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase news axles and perform autobody maintenance

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “Paz Y Progreso” está constituida por 12 mujeres emprendedoras que buscan mejorar cada día. Mery de 29 años  es separada y tiene 01 hijo aún dependiente. Actualmente inició  un  negocio  juntamente  con su madre, la cual cuenta con  un restaurante. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo puede brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo, pues él  ha sido su motivo para seguir adelante. Posteriormente le gustaría aperturar otro restaurante. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos  y leche en mayor cantidad ya que así le sale económico. El grupo “Paz Y Progreso” agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Mery se encuentra en la parte posterior es la tercera del lado derecho,  viste polo rosado y casaca azul.
texts.en:
This group, ”Paz y Progreso” [Peace and Progress], is composed of twelve women trying to improve every day. Mery, 29, is separated and has a dependent child. She recently opened a restaurant together with her mother. She feels happy knowing that thanks to her hard work, she will be able to give her son a better quality of life. He is her motivation in life. She would like to open another restaurant in the future.

This time she is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles and milk in greater quantities in order to get a better price. The members of the group “Paz y Progreso” appreciate the support given and promise to continue working hard. Mery is the one standing in the back, third from right to left, and is wearing a pink t-shirt and a blue sweater.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles and milk.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es: Doña Maria casada, madre de dos niños, esta dedicada a cumplir uno de sus mayores sueños, terminar su casa de habitacion, ella labora para una empresa privada y su esposo la apoya en todas las decisionas ya que para los dos su prioridad son sus hijos, por diferentes situaciones ellos no han podido recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para comprara los materiales que necesita por lo que han confiado en nosotros para un financiamiento y asi comprar Hierro, Cemento, Arena, Piedrin, Perlines, Zinc etc. con esto podran practicamente terminarla ya que los bloques ya los tienen y ellos esperan seguir contando con el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Maria is married and the mother of two children. She is dedicated to fulfilling one of her greatest dreams, to finish her house. She works for a private company and her husband supports her in all decisions, as the priority for both of them is their children. 

Due to various circumstances they haven't been able to put together at one time the money to buy the materials needed, so they have relied on us for a loan and this way will buy rebar, cement, sand, gravel, purlins, sheet metal roofing, etc.

With this they will able to practically complete it, as they already have the cement blocks, and they hope to continue having the support that Afodenic and Kiva have offered them.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Li

texts.en:
From Chrang Chamreh Mouy of Reussey Keo district, Li, age 52, is a hardworking mother who runs a small business at home selling breakfast. 

Every day, she has to get up at dawn to cook porridge and prepare everything for her store, and then she starts selling her breakfast at 7 a.m., and finishes it around 9 a.m. From this business, she is able to make a net profit of $6.4 per day, which she uses for daily food and other expenses.

Li wants to acquire a loan to provide enough study materials for her daughter, who is pursuing a bachelor degree. That’s why she has applied for a loan amounting to 700 US dollars to buy a laptop. This will encourage her daughter to produce good results in her education and earn a professional degree.

Thanks lenders for a constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for her daughter.

loans.name: Odina

texts.en:
Odina is 27 years old from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two children. Her husband is a carpenter. Odina has been engaged in the Sari-sari store business for quite some time now. In her store, she sells canned goods, biscuits, bread, shampoo, cooking oil, and coffee. 

She is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, detergent, chips, condiments, and toiletries. Odina works hard for her family. And whatever income that she will generate from her business goes towards educating her children and paying for school fees.

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store and be successful in sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergent, chips, condiments, and toiletries

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana continúa trabajando en el área de carpinteria con su esposo y sus hijos en el taller de su propiedad. Sigue viviendo en la ciudad de El Alto, su negocio ha crecido y ahora necesita crédito para comprar una máquina gloreadora y torneadora, ya que tiene planeado fabricar puertas de distintos tamaños pero hechas con material resistente y de calidad.
texts.en: Juana continues working in carpentry with her husband and children in their own shop. She continues living in the city of El Alto. Her business has grown and now she needs a loan to buy lathe and milling machine, since she has planned to make doors of different sizes but made with resistant and high-quality material.

loans.use: to buy machines for her carpentry shop.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuya, 43 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a pawnshop for three years. Her husband renders services, such as recharging printers and canons for his client organizations.

She is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cements, fiberglass, and foam, in order to renovate her old house. By doing so, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cements, fiberglass, and foam,  to renovate her old house.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es: Elmer tiene 56 años de edad, está casado y tiene una hija con quien vive en su casa propia. Elmer se dedica a la siembra y venta de yuca y plátano, tiene una experiencia de 15 años en el rubro, se inició con esta actividad gracias a su esposa , la perseverancia en su trabajo lo impulsan a lograr  buenas cosechas en la producción de sus cultivos. El  principal problema en esta actividad son los factores climatológicos (lluvias)  y las  variación que sufre el precio, un día sube, otro día baja, pero gracias a su experiencia y a sus conocimientos ha sabido sacar adelante la producción, lo que ahora espera es aumentar sus terrenos del cultivo. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva por lo que está muy agradecido y contento por el apoyo económico recibido y la oportunidad  de  seguir creciendo. El dinero solicitado de S/.1200.00 está destinado para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Elmer is 56 years old, married, and has a daughter, and they all live in their own house. Elmer grows and sells yucca and plátano, and has 15 years of experience in this. He started this activity thanks to his wife, and perseverance in their work pushes them to achieve good yields in their crop production.

The main problems in this business are the climatic factors (rainfall) and price variation - one day up, another down - but thanks to his experience and knowledge he has managed to push production through. What he hopes now is to improve his crop lands. This is his first Kiva loan, and he is grateful and happy for the economic support and the opportunity to continue growing. The requested loan of S/. 1200 is destined for the purchase of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
Maximo is an ice-supplier in the market and in town where ice is used by refreshments shops and fish vendors. For two years he has been supplying ice to make a living. He is 55 years old and married with three children. 

He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to acquire a freezer for his ice-supply business. An amount of 25,000 PHP will help his business improve and succeed.

loans.use: to acquire a freezer for his ice-supply business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
This is Irene. She previously accessed an 23,000 PHP loan that she used for the repair and maintenance of an apartment she rents out for income. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures. She also sells some snacks for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 36,000 PHP loan that she will use for the repair and maintenance of an apartment for rent. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Irene dreams of seeing her business expanding. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: pay for the repair and maintenance of her rental apartment.

loans.name: Vema

texts.en:
Vema is a young entrepreneur, married with two children, and resides in Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She runs a general store to make a living. 

Vema borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase rice and corn grits for sale as additional working capital. She wants to prove that with this little amount she can provide for the needs of her children and be able to improve the living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits for sale as additional working capital

loans.name: Norma Enedina

texts.es:
Doña Norma a sus 52 años de edad es una mujer con muchas fuerzas, con muchos sueños y esperanzas las cuales poco a poco ha visto realizar en el trayecto a lo largo de su vida. Tiene 52 años de edad, casada y es madre de 5 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ellos y se involucran en las diferentes actividades en el campo como: limpieza, aplicación de abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas, etc. que conllevan  a la mejora y protección de sus cultivos de café. Ella tiene 25 años de dedicarse a este rubro lo cual aprendió de sus padres a muy temprana edad por lo que decidió dedicarse a trabajar la tierra cuando se casó ya que su esposo es agricultor siendo este el único medio de ingreso y fortalecimiento económico en su familia y hogar. La tierra que trabajan es propia la cual está ubicada a 15 minutos de camino de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente para asistirla y cuidar de ella.

Sus sueños son los de poder algún día ser una compradora fuerte de café y al mismo tiempo productora del mismo generando ganancias para fortalecer la economía de su hogar, fortaleciendo el patrimonio para sus hijos y apoyarlos en todas y cada una de sus metas. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara urea, fertilizantes, abono, insecticidas entre otros y podrá limpiar sus cultivos de café de plagas y maleza
texts.en:
Norma at 52 years old is a woman with many strengths, and many hopes and dreams that little by little she has been able to realize throughout her life's trajectory.  She is 52 years old, married and the mother of 5 children, 3 of whom live with them and are involved in the various activities on the plantation that help improve and protect the coffee crops such as: weeding, applying manure, fertilizing, applying insecticides, etc... She has dedicated herself to this work for 25 years, and she learned it from her parents at a very early age, which is why she decided to dedicate herself to working the land when she married her husband since he was a farmer as well.  This is the only means of income and economic growth for her family and household.  The land they work is their, and is a 15 minute walk from their home.  They make the walk everyday to tend to their land.  

Her dreams are to someday be a strong coffee buyer and at the same time a producer, generating revenues to improve her household finances, strengthening the patrimony for her children and supporting them in all of their goals.  This is why she is seeking a loan with which she will purchase urea, fertilizers, manure, insecticides, etc... and be able to clean her coffee crops of pests and weeds.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies and clean out weeds in her coffee crops

loans.name: Tsolmontuya

texts.en: Mrs. Tsolmontuya, 37 years old, lives with her sister and seven-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Her sister is disabled and gets a pension from the state. Mrs. Tsolmontuya has been selling sweets, biscuits, and chocolates to local people by renting a stall at the food market since 2007. This sales business is income on which the family depends. Mrs. Tsolmontuya is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase foodstuffs in large quantities so that she can continue to run her business without worrying about an inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs in large quantities to sell at her stall

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Ahora trabaja por mas de 10 horas al día dando un servicio de fotocopiado al frente de una universidad en la ciudad. Requiere el crédito para la compra de una máquina fotocopiadora moderna que no gaste tanta tinta y energía como las antiguas que tiene, además, Rodrigo necesita una máquina que no segrege sustancias tóxicas.

El sueño de Rodrigo es poder tener mejores ingresos para poder ser un apoyo para sus padres.
texts.en: Rodrigo’ single living in his parents’ house in the city of La Paz’s Tembladerani zone.  He’s now working more than ten hours daily providing photocopying services across from a university in the city.  He needs the loan to buy a modern photocopying machine that won’t waste so much ink and energy like the old ones he has.  His dream is to be able to earn higher income to be able to be a source of support for his parents.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 22 años, es soltero y vive en su casa propia junto a sus padres. Se caracteriza por  ser una persona muy emprendedora. Se dedica  a la venta de ropas de segunda mano, hace 05 años que se dedica al negocio, se inició en el negocio a través que su tía quien vendía ropas de segunda y él trabajaba con ella, vio  la oportunidad de vender su propia  mercadería y comenzó a independizarse , con el paso de los meses entendió que el negocio era muy rentable, por lo cual decidió comenzar con este negocio. Luis espera seguir creciendo con su negocio y uno de sus sueños es contar con una tienda de venta de ropas de segunda. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, y está muy emocionado por el apoyo económico que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El préstamo adquirido de S/.2000 soles será destinado para la compra de ropas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Luis, 22, is single living in his own house with his parents.  He’s noted for being a very enterprising person.  He sells second-hand clothes and has been in business five years.  He started the business through his aunt who sold second-hand clothes; he worked with her.  He recognized the opportunity of selling his own merchandise and started to become independent.  As months went by he noticed that the business was profitable so he decided to start this business.

Luis hopes to continue growing with his business and one of his dreams is to own a second-hand clothing store.  This is his first Kiva loan and he’s very excited for the economic support he’s getting to continue forward.  He also commits to make his payments punctually.  He will use the 2,000 sol loan obtained to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy es casado y tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son todos independientes, viven en casa propia ocupando cuatro habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja en su imprenta por mas de diez horas al día, y con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, pago de servicios básicos y pago de alquiler de su imprenta.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una maquina para hacer credenciales,ya que con esto mejorara sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida., la imprenta es su única fuente de ingresos, así que necesita una máquina moderna que no gaste demasiada materia prima.
El sueño de Freddy es construir un ambiente en su casa para implementar su imprenta y ahorrar en el pago de alquileres, de esta forma también tener mas comodidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
Freddy’s married and has three children who are all independent now.  They live in his own, four-bedroom house located in the city of La Paz.  He currently works in his print shop for more than ten hours daily and uses income earned there to pay food, utilities and his print shop’s rent.

He needs the loan to buy a machine to make IDs since this will improve his income and also his quality of life; his print shop is his only source of income. He needs a modern machine that does not waste as much raw material. Freddy’s dream is to build a space at home to set up his print shop and save on rental costs thus also having more comfort and security.

loans.use: to buy an ID-making machine.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andres, de 46 años de edad, está casado y vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposa y sus hijos de 13 y 05  años de edad respectivamente. Andres se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles por eso cuenta con una tienda instalada en su casa, desde  donde atiende a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos, lleva 5 años realizando está actividad y hasta el momento lo hace sola. Le  gusta su trabajo pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su hogar y a la vez generar ingresos económicos para su familia. Por lo contrario, lo que no le gusta es cuando algunos de sus clientes se retrasan en el pago de sus créditos concedidos, pero eso no la desanima y continúa trabajado con las mismas ganas, ahora tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer. Este es segundo préstamo con Kiva, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, leche, azúcar, entre otros.
texts.en:
Andres, is 46 years old. He is married and lives in his own home with his wife and their children of 13 and 5 years of age, respectively.  

Andres works selling groceries from a store he has established in his home, where he can attend to his customers which are mostly his own neighbors. He has been doing this work for 5 years and so far has been working alone. He likes his work as it permits him to be in the comfort of his home and at at same time he can generate financial income for his family. On the other hand, what he does not like is when some of his customers are late paying for the credit he granted, but that does not discourage him and he will continue working towards the same goals, now having plans to continue on with his business and making it grow.

This is his second loan with Kiva, so he is hoping for your assistance so that he can firm up his plans, and he agrees to make his payments punctually. With the 2,000 soles he will buy groceries such as rice, milk, sugar, and other items.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, milk, sugar, among other items.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lea works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Lea is borrowing PHP 17,500 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Lea has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Genevilla

texts.en: Genevilla is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Genevilla is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed for her pigs. Genevilla has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to clean up his farm and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Marta Dilia

texts.es:
Doña Marta curso hasta quinto grado de la primaria en su juventud y actualmente está cursando el sexto grado con un proyecto por parte del gobierno. Su esposo llego hasta quinto grado pero sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra por lo cual en compañía de su esposa trabajan de la mano para sacar su familia adelante y poder darles una mejor educación. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en dichas actividades por lo que también se especializa en la elaboración de viveros para su venta o siembra. Su familia es muy numerosa la cual está compuesta por 11 hijos de los cuales viven con ella 8 y tres estudian en la ciudad. Delos ocho que viven con ella uno se dedica al sacerdocio, otro estudia bachillerato en computación, otro de sus hijos trabaja en una guardería, una de sus hijas estudia bachiller en informática en una aldea de la comunidad, otro de sus hijos con 14 años está en noveno grado, otro de 13 años está en octavo grado y el ultimo de 8 en tercer grado en la primaria, con ellos vive un nieto de 2 años de edad. El negocio es el cultivo de café y también frijoles pero los frijoles solo para gasto del hogar. Desde niña ella aprendió la agricultura con sus padres y luego siguió practicando con su esposo. La tierra que juntos trabajan es una herencia que le dejaron a su esposo y otra que han comprado poco a poco las cuales están ubicadas en la misma casa.

El sueño de doña Marta es que todos sus hijos sean profesionales, ya que ella piensa que aunque no les deje cosas materiales el estudio es la mejor arma para tener un futuro exitoso y que el conocimiento dura para siempre. Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas para fortalecer sus cultivos de café mediante la aplicación de abono, foliares, fertilizantes, etc. que ayudaran a mejorar desde la raíz hasta el grano al final de la cosecha.
texts.en:
Marta attended school until fifth grade and now she is attending sixth grade with a government project. Her husband attended school until fifth grade but his parents taught him to work the land, which with his wife, they work together to get their family ahead and be able to give them a better education. She has a lot of experience in this activity and also specializes in the production of nurseries for its sale and planting. 

Her family is very large, she has 11 children, 8 of whom live with her and 3 of whom are studying in the city. Of the eight that live with her one is in the priesthood, another studies computers, another works in a day-care center, one of her daughters studies computer science in a village in the community, her 14 year old is in 9th grade, her 13 year old is in 8th grade and the youngest is 8 and is in 3rd grade. Her 2-year-old grandson lives with her. 

The business is coffee growing and beans but the beans are only for their family's consumption. Since she was a little girl she learned to farm with her parents and later continued working with her husband. The land that they work on together is an inheritance that was left to her husband and the other they bought slowly. They are both located in the same place.


Marta's dream is for all her children to become professionals. She believes that although she doesn't leave them material things; studying is the best weapon to have for a successful future and that knowledge always lasts. 

This is the reason she is requesting a loan, to purchase agricultural supplies to strengthen their coffee crops through the application of manure, plant fertilizer, fertilizer etc...  It will help to improve the crops from the roots, to the grain, and to the harvest.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia is 53 years old and married with ten children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Celedonia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

Celedonia has been pig fattening for 10 years, and earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Erineo

texts.es: El Sr. Erineo tiene 26 años el se dedica a la actividad de la pesca  el vive en una isla del lago titicaca, centro turístico del departamento de La Paz donde ofrecen al público  artesanías  de totoras y en lana, la mayoría de los habitantes de esta isla se dedican a la pesca y el turismo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Erineo va a usar este préstamo para compra de redes para usar en la pesca, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumentar la pesca e incrementar su capital  de trabajo, el Sr. Erineo va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando en su trabajo ya que este es su único ingreso para mantenerse, el Sr. Erineo es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Erineo, 26, is a fisherman who lives on an island in Lake Titicaca, a tourist area in La Paz department that offers visitors straw and wool handicrafts. Most of the residents work in the fishing and tourism industries.

This is the member's first loan cycle with the institution. Erineo will use the loan to buy fishing nets so that he can increase his catch and have more working capital. Erineo will use his profits to keep working, as this is his only income source. Erineo works hard and is pleased to have this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Pepitas De Cobre *** Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PEPITAS DE COBRE ***,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Blanca, ella tiene 62 años, casada con dos hijos que son mayores d edad,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de variedad de repostería como pasteles y variedad de queques , su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la zona primero de Mayo  de la ciudad de El Alto,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Blanca va a usar este préstamo para la compra de  un horno industrial de mayor capacidad ya quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, La Sra. blanca con este crédito mejorara sus ganancias, La Sra. Blanca es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: The communal bank, Pepitas de Cobre ***, consists of eight members - six women and two men.  Blanca is the bank's president.  She is 62 years old and is married with two grown children.
