She makes and sells a variety of baked goods such as pastries and various kinds of cakes.  Her bakery is located in the Primero de Mayo zone in the city of El Alto.  This loan is her first cycle with the institution, and Blanca will use the loan to buy an industrial oven with increased capacity. She wants to increase her output and satisfy the demand of her clients. With this loan Blanca will improve her earnings. She is a person with a strong desire to get ahead.  She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support it has provided as this is the only means she has to provide for herself.

loans.use: to buy and industrial oven.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La Sra. Delia  vive en pareja, tiene 34 años, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty. Ella tiene un hotel hace cuatro años, el cual está ubicado en una zona estratégica de la cuidad.
Ella es la principal referente allí, y comenta que está saliendo adelante gracias a su esfuerzo. Solicita de esta ayuda para la construcción de un mejor baño para sus clientes, ya que de esa forma podrá darles un mejor servicio. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Delia is 34 years old and lives with her partner. She is from the city of Curuguaty. For the last 4 years Delia has had a hotel, which is situated in a strategic location in the city. She is the main person in charge there and says that she is making progress thanks to her hard work.

Delia is asking for this loan to build a better bathroom for her clients, so that she can provide them with a better service. She is grateful for this opportunity she is being given to carry on growing the business.

loans.use: to build a bathroom for clients.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas está en su 16 ciclo del programa de comité, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde 7 de ellas están con un indicador bajo y necesitan seguir trabajado para mejorar sus vidas.
Gloria es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la peluquería, y cuenta que tiene una buena clientela que siempre va hasta su negocio, ya que siempre las atiende muy bien y les da lo que necesitan. Ella lucha por ir creciendo y mejorando cada día.
Solicita hoy de este crédito para poder invertirlo en insumos para su peluquería, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Unidas" group is in its 16th loan cycle in the communal bank program. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, where seven of them have a low indicator and need to continue working to improve their lives. 

Gloria is one of the members and she works as a hairdresser. She says that she has a good clientele who always come to her shop, as she always serves them very well and gives them what they need. She is striving to grow and improve little by little every day.

Now she is applying for this loan so that she can purchase supplies for her beauty salon, such as shampoo, rinses, tints, creams and other products. That way she will be able to continue serving her customers well.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, rinses, tints, creams and other products.

loans.name: Yudy

texts.es: Yudy tiene  28 años, vive en su casa propia construida a base de madera  junto a su esposo y su hijo de 6 años. Posee un terreno de cultivo de 2 hectáreas que compró desde muy joven donde actualmente se dedica a mantener sus plantaciones en buen estado porque le permite obtener una buena calidad de los frutos en la cosecha y venderlos a buen precio en los centros de venta de su localidad. Se inicio por iniciativa de sus padres a quienes apoyaba desde niña en las distintas tareas concernientes a la agricultura. Usa solo abono orgánico para ayudar al crecimiento óptimo de sus plantaciones porque sus terrenos de cultivo son muy fértiles. No obstante esto también favorece al crecimiento de maleza que debe cortar constantemente con la ayuda de jornaleros a quienes paga por adelantado. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y nutrir así sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Yudy is 28 years old. She lives in her own home, built on a wooden foundation, with her husband and their six-year-old son. She has 2 hectares of land for farming, which she bought at a young age. This is where she farms her best crops because it allows her to gain good quality fruits in her harvest to sell at a good price in the markets of her town. She started with the help of her parents, who taught her at a young age how to complete various agricultural skills. She only uses organic fertilizer to help grow the optimum crops because her land is very fertile. However, this can also lead to the growth of weeds, which she has to constantly pull with the help of contractors who she pays in advance.

This is her second loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial help she gets to continue forward. She also promises to pay her bills on time. Currently, she is requesting 3,000 nuevo soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her seeds.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: El Sr. Wilder tiene 36 años,  el se dedica  a la venta de comida, almuerzos y cena en su pequeña pensión que se encuentra en la  localidad de la Guardia,  el Sr. Wilder es una persona muy trabajadora  y amable atiende muy bien a sus clientes razón por la cual su pensión es muy concurrida y también por la buena sazón de sus alimentos,  con el dinero del crédito comprara un frizer y mesas y sillas para brindar comodidad a su clientes, ya que está incrementando su clientela y por ende sus ingresos económicos, El Sr. Wilder se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito, el deseo del Sr. Wilder es tener un gran restaurante y así de esta manera mejorar su clientela y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilder is 36 years old.  He earns his living by selling food, including lunches and dinners, from a small diner in the town of La Guardia.  Sr. Wilder is a very hardworking and friendly individual who provides good service to his customers.  His diner is very busy for this reason as well as for the good flavor of his dishes.  

The money from this loan will be used to buy a freezer, tables, and chairs so that his customers will be comfortable.  He will be able to increase his clientele and eventually earn more income.  Sr. Wilder is pleased and expresses his appreciation to Emprender for the support that has been provided through this loan.  His wish is to have a large restaurant so that he can improve his clientele and also his income.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es: Ever es un joven de 21 años, está casado y tiene un hijo de un año con quien vive en su casa propia. Cuando terminó sus estudios secundarios se comprometió y tuvo a su primer hijo teniendo desde entonces una gran responsabilidad, es por ello que al no tener un empleo estable recibió por parte de sus padres una terreno agrícola con plantaciones de cacao orgánico que le sirvió para obtener sus primeros ingresos en beneficio de su joven familia. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo ya que es una labor que aprendió desde muy niño gracias a sus padres. No obstante para obtener una buena calidad de los frutos debe fertilizar necesariamente con abono orgánico. Uno de sus principales objetivos es lograr la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas como machetes, serruchos de podar y la contrata de trabajadores del lugar para brindarle el respectivo mantenimiento a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en: Ever is 21 years old, married and has a one year old son. His family all lives in their own home. When he finished secondary school, he got married and had his first child and has had a lot of responsibility ever since. He has also not had steady employment and so his parents gave him a piece of land to grow organic cacao. This work has provided him with his first income that helps him care for his family. He is very dedicated to his work because it is a skill he has been learning since he was a child, thanks to his parents. However, in order to get a better quality fruit he needs to use organic fertilizer. One of his primary objectives is to be able to build a home with durable materials. This is his fourth loan with Kiva and he is thankful for all the financial support that he has received. With this loan he is going to use the money to purchase tools like machetes, saws and to hire workers to help him care for his cacao fields.

loans.use: purchase tools like machete, saws and to hire workers.

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es: Llerme, de 56 años, está casada con Héctor y tiene varios quienes ya son mayores e independientes con quienes vive en su casa propia. Llerme se dedica a la venta de comidas, sale todos los días al mercado para comprar los ingredientes para preparar sus distintos platos comidas. Tiene un local en el interior de su vivienda en donde por las mañana vende desayunos, todo su trabajo lo realiza con al ayuda de dos sobrinas para que le ayuden en la atención a los clientes y lleva trabajando ahí por al menos 10 años. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.2000, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Por otro se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará  víveres como arroz, azúcar, plátano, huevos, entre otros para preparar sus comidas.
texts.en:
Llerme, 56, is married to Héctor and they have several children who are all independent adults now living with them in their own house.  Llerme works selling food.  She heads out to the market every day to buy ingredients to prepare her various dishes.  She has a space inside her house where she sells breakfasts in the morning.  She does the work with help from two nieces who help her with customer service.  She’s been working there for at least 10 years.

On this occasion she’s requesting 2,000 soles.  She’s grateful and happy to know that she will be able to count on financial support she needs to make progress in her business.  On the other hand, she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the amount requested to buy food items like rice, sugar, bananas, eggs and others to prepare her meals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, bananas, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa runs a general store in the town of Sinacaban in Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. Her husband serves as a barangay councilor in their community. She has been running her store to earn a living for five years. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery and first aid items to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her business and be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more grocery and first aid items to sell

loans.name: Ruena

texts.en:
Ruena is 39 years old, and is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with six children ages 6-20.
Ruena farms vegetables like okra and string beans to help raise her children. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings. Ruena hopes that with a loan, she will be able to produce more for her family's needs.

In the future, she hopes to see her children be successful in their schooling.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 41 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Analiza is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy pesticide for her farm.

Analiza has been farming rice for 26 years and also earns additional income by selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy pesticide for her farm

loans.name: Elfha

texts.en:
Elfha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Elfha has been in this business for 10 years, and she also earns income from farming vegetables and working at a general store.

Elfha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Laura Isabel

texts.es:
Laura es una mujer de 35 años, los estudios que cursó son primarios y se casó siendo muy joven con Rommel con quien aparece en la foto y que ahora tiene 30 años y trabaja como  guardia de seguridad con horarios extendidos y con quien tiene dos hijos de 15 y 8 años respectivamente. Viven en Los Bancos un cantón de la Provincia de Pichincha, una de las provincias  más grandes en la República del Ecuador. Este cantón se encuentra a pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Quito, y tiene diversidad de bosques, además sus barrios están poblados con gente amable y costumbres propias de esta ciudad. Laura y su familia viven en una zona alejada del pueblo, en la finca que también es su campo de trabajo. 
Al ser este cantón una zona tropical, es el lugar en donde se dan las plantaciones de frutas tropicales más demandadas en el mercado nacional e internacional, es por esto que Laura hace 5 años emprendió la producción de cacao, cuya actividad aprendió de varios familiares que se dedicaron a la agricultura. Con la ayuda de sus suegros se dedica a su negocio al menos 8 horas cada día, y la parte que más le toma tiempo es la recolección del cacao que es en forma manual y requiere de mucho cuidado, pues al hacerlo con machete hay riesgos de cortarse o sufrir algún accidente. Laura cuenta que en la finca tienen espacio que no está siendo aprovechado y es por eso que requiere un préstamo para implementar nuevos cultivos de plátano y maíz que le generarán mayores utilidades y además le ayudarán a dar pasos de avance para poder adquirir en el futuro el terreno en donde mantienen sus cultivos. Laura sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y por eso para ella es muy valioso haber recibido el apoyo de Fundación Alternativa y los inversionistas de Kiva quienes aún sin estar en su país aportan para hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Laura's a 35-year-old woman.  She completed elementary school and got married at a young age to Rommel, who appears in the photo and is now 30 and works an extended schedule as a security guard.  They have two children, ages 15 and 8.

They live in Los Bancos, a canton in the province of Pinchincha, one of the largest provinces in the Republic of Ecuador.  This canton is located a few kilometers from the city of Quito and has a variety of forests.  In addition, the people who live in the neighborhoods there are friendly and have traditions typical of this city.  Laura and her family live in an area away from town, on the farm where she also works.

This canton is in a tropical area so there are farms that produce the tropical fruits that are in most demand in the national and international markets.  This is why Laura started growing cacao five years ago.  She learned the job from several relatives who work in agriculture.  She works at least eight hours a day with the help of her parents-in-law.  The most time-consuming part is harvesting the cacao.  It's a manual task that takes a lot of care because there are risks of getting cut or having an accident when working with a machete.

Laura says she's not making the most of some space on the farm, so she's requesting a loan to start growing new crops, bananas and corn.  These will earn more profits for her as well as help her take steps toward being able, in the future, to buy the land where they grow their crops.

Laura dreams of seeing her children become professionals.  This is why it's so useful for her to have received the support of Fundación Alternativa and the Kiva lenders who, even though they're not in her country, contribute to making her dreams come true.

loans.use: to grow bananas and corn

loans.name: And Siggil Hann 6 Group

texts.fr: L’Association And Siggil Hann regroupe plusieurs femmes ressortissant de l’une des banlieues Dakaroises. Au départ elles se fréquentaient a travers des tontines  hebdomadaires  qui leur permettaient de s’autofinancer pour soutenir leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Actuellement l’association vient de signer un partenariat avec l’UIMCEC dans le cadre du renforcement du pouvoir économique des femmes pour les aider a mieux gérer leurs activités et lutter contre la pauvreté. De ce fait And Siggil Hann 6 est un groupe de crédit de 10 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et évolue dans le même secteur d’activité. Elles sont représentées par madame Aminata, femme mariée qui pratique depuis 5 ans l’activité commerciale de vente de tissus . Elle démarre chaque jour sa journée e de travail a 9 heures du matin pour descendre a 16 heures. Les bénéfices que lui procure son activité lui permettent de participer a la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de tissus destinés  a la vente. Elle souhaite augmenter les bénéfices qu’elle réalise a travers ce prêt. Elle souhaite contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Elle ambitionne aussi d’épargner de l’argent et acquérir dans le futur son propre magasin de tissus.
texts.en:
The "And Siggil Hann" group comprises ten women from one of Dakar's suburbs.  In the past, these women used to interact with one another through weekly savings groups' meetings which allowed them to self-finance and support their income-generating activities.  With the aim of strengthening the economic power of women, the group has recently entered into partnership with the UIMCEC, whose mission is to help them to better manage their professional activities and come out of poverty.  "And Siggil Hann 6" is therefore a credit group consisting of women who live in the same neighborhood and are involved in the same type of business.  

The group's representative is named Aminata.  She is a married woman who has been selling fabrics for 5 years. Aminata works from 9 AM until 4 PM every day.  With the profits that she makes from her business, she is able to contribute to the daily expenses of the family.  

Aminata is a member of one of the local branches of the UIMCEC and she is requesting a loan to buy some fabrics for resale.  Through this loan, she is hoping to see an increase in her profits.  She would also like to contribute to the improvement of her family's food conditions.  Her goal is to save some money and, in the future, to open her own fabric shop.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Berawan Salak Permai Group

texts.en: To improve the quality of livestock, The Berawan Salak Permai Group continues to seek loans.  Ni Kadek will use this loan to buy super quality piglets for fattening.  Selling prices for super quality pork remain high, and it is easier to sell.  The pigs will be maintained for 6 months. She hopes the pigs' growth will be healthy and that the ideal weight will be achieved. Ni Kadek is planning to save all of the profit, and it will be used for working capital.

loans.use: to buy super quality piglets

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NIMPRODIOULA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le pois sucré avec Mme KOROTOUMOU ISSA debout en troisième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 2 Group are married women who, on average, are 48 years old and have four children each. They are all living in polygamous families at Nimprodioula, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid. Their crop is sweet peas.
Korotoumou Issa (standing third from left) intends to use her loan to pay for plowing and to buy seed and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectares. The produce is sold at the village and at Sikasso, after the harvest, to male and female customers. She expects to earn an average income of 95.000 f CFA per year. This income will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy farm inputs and agricultural seeds

loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es: Reynaldo José Mayor de edad, casado con un hijo menor de edad y del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como: ropa, zapatos de niños, cosméticos, entre otros, negocio el cual lo tiene de forma de ambulante tiene clientes fijos y eventuales da al crédito y al contado los cuales recupera semanal y quincenalmente, el desde muy temprano sale a la calle a entregar su mercadería y a vender a la misma vez va recuperando lo invertido, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en compra de mercadería como: zapatos, cosméticos, variedades de ropa entre otros, Reynaldo agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajo recursos económicos .-
texts.en:
Reynaldo José is married and has one minor child. He is from the town of Chinandega, located in the western area of the country. He works selling merchandise in general, such as clothing, children's shoes, cosmetics, and other items. He is a street vendor and has regular and occasional customers. He sells for cash as well as on credit, for which he collects payments weekly and biweekly. He goes out on the street very early in the morning to deliver his merchandise and make sales. At the same time, he recovers his investments. 

The purpose of this loan is to invest in byuing merchandise like shoes, cosmetics, assorted clothing, and other items. Reynaldo is very grateful for the support Kiva lenders offer to people with low income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in general, such as clothing, cosmetics, plastic products, and other items.

loans.name: Centre De Sante Virunga Group

texts.fr: La cliente Pauline est infirmière. Elle est Infirmière titulaire (IT) et le leader  du collectif d’affaire des infirmiers et personnel para médical du « Centre de santé Virunga», âgé de 39 ans et  mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Son époux est un commerçant de divers. La cliente vit de son travail et elle est confortable avec ce métier d’infirmier. Le nouveau prêt va la servir  dans son projet d’habitat (construction maison). Ainsi, elle souhaite renouveler son prêt prochainement et lancer le projet de commerce. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit au personnel soignant.
texts.en:
Pauline, age 39, is a licensed nurse and the leader of the Virunga health center's nursing and paramedical personnel’s business group. She has seven children who all go to school, and her husband is a merchant who sells various merchandise. 

Katsongo’s profession allows her to make a living, and she is comfortable in this career. 

This new loan will help her to pursue her project to build a house. She plans to renew this loan in the short term to launch a commercial activity. 

She wants to thank the Hekima MFI for supporting nursing personnel through microfinance.

loans.use: to build a new house.

loans.name: And Siggil Hann 11 Group

texts.fr: L’Association And Siggil Hann regroupe plusieurs femmes ressortissant de l’une des banlieues au Sénégal. Au départ elles se fréquentaient a travers des tontines  hebdomadaires  qui leur permettaient de s’autofinancer pour soutenir leurs activités génératrices de revenus .Actuellement l’association vient de signer un partenariat avec l’UIMCEC dans le cadre du renforcement du pouvoir économique des femmes  pour les aider  a mieux gérer leurs activités et lutter contre la pauvreté. De ce fait And Siggil Hann 11  est un groupe de crédit de 9 femmes  qui habitent le même quartier et évolue dans le même secteur d’activité. Elles sont représentées par madame Aminata, femme mariée qui  évolue dans le secteur du commerce pratique depuis plus de 10 ans  la  vente de jus de fruits, d’habits et  de tissus divers. Elle démarre chaque jour sa journée  de travail a 8 heures du matin pour descendre a  20 heures la nuit. Les bénéfices que lui procure son activité lui permettent de participer a la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de tissus et d’habits  destinés  a la vente. Elle souhaite augmenter les bénéfices qu’elle réalise a travers ce prêt. Elle souhaite contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Elle ambitionne aussi d’épargner de l’argent et acquérir dans le futur une boutique de cosmétiques  et de grands magasins de tissus.
texts.en:
And Siggil Hann is a group made up of several women coming from one of the suburbs of Senegal. In the beginning, the women were part of neighborhood savings groups that allowed them to finance themselves in order to support their revenue-generating businesses. Currently, the group has just partnered with UIMCEC with the goal of increasing the economic power of the women to help them better conduct their businesses and to protect against poverty.

As a result, And Siggil Hann 11 is a borrowing group of 9 women who live in the same neighborhood and who have pursued the same type of business. They are represented by Aminata, a married woman who has been in the business of selling fruit juice, clothing, and assorted fabrics for over 10 years. She begins each work day at 8am and works until 8pm in the evening.

The profits that Aminata earns through her business allow her to help out with the everyday expenses of her household. She is the member of one of the branches of UIMCEC where she is requesting a loan to purchase fabric and clothes for resale. She hopes to increase the profits she earns with this loan. She hopes to contribute to the improvement of her family's dietary conditions. She also hopes to save money and in the future to acquire a cosmetics shop and large fabric shops.

loans.use: purchase clothes and fabric to resell

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité , donde todas están con mucho entusiasmo y quieren poder salir adelante para ayudar a sus familias, quieren aprender y capacitarse y ser mejores en lo que hacen.
Una de las integrantes es Nidia, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero ella es consciente de que debe seguir trabajando y esforzándose para llegar a su meta. Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de librería, hay que destacar que ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante.
La Sra. Nidia solicita de este crédito para la compra de Artículos de librería, como ser lápices, borradores, cuadernos, reglas, sacapuntas, hojas blancas, etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
San Cayetano is in its first phase of the committee program. 

They are all very enthusiastic and they want to get ahead to help their families. They want to learn and train and get better at what they do. 

One of the members is Nidia, who in her last survey showed level one poverty, this is to say very low incomes, but she is conscious that she needs to keep working and striving to reach her goal. 

She sells bookshop items. It needs to be highlighted that she is a hard worker who wants to get ahead. 

Nidia is requesting a loan to buy bookstore items such as pencils, erasers, notebooks, rulers, pencil sharpeners, blank paper etc. which will help her solidify her business plan which will help improve her income.

loans.use: to buy pencils, erasers, notebooks, rulers, pencil sharpeners, blank paper etc.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 3º del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una persona digna de destacar es Luciana, quien se dedica a la venta de carne, ella es una persona que se ha esforzado mucho por su familia para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Por medio de su trabajo  y su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y mejorando cada día más. Ella quiere capacitarse y seguir creciendo. Solicita de este crédito ya que quiere invertirlo en la compra de carne, y de esa forma seguir ofreciendo una buena calidad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called “San Cayetano” is in its third cycle in the committee program.  All of them work and help each other to get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey.

One of the women worthy of mention is Luciana who sells meat.  She’s a person who has striven mightily for her family in order to be able to give them everything she herself never had.  She’s getting ahead by means of her work and effort and is improving more every day.  She wants to get training and continue to grow.  

She’s requesting this loan because she wants to invest in in meat in order to continue offering good quality products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meats to sell.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: Isabel Cristina de 36 años de edad, madre soltera de cinco hijos aun menores de edad  originaria de unos de los municipios  del departamento de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, es propietaria y administradora de una pulpería que está situada en su casa de habitación, en la que ofrece todo tipo de productos de consumo básico como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabones, detergentes, gaseosas, golosinas, y otros además vende ropa y cosméticos, tiene 1 año de haber empezado con este negocio, el cual lo emprendió con capital propio, ella hace sus compras a camiones distribuidores, mercados de mayoreos entre otros. Uno de sus sueños es mejor a sus hijos convertidos profesionalmente al igual que mejorar su vivienda y brindarles mejor seguridad a sus hijos. El objetivo de este  crédito es para surtir más su pulpería debido a que su establecimiento está teniendo mayor demanda de parte de sus consumidores y así es una manera de que su negocio vaya  obteniendo más ingresos y de esta manera estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Isabel Cristina, who is 36 years old, is a single mother of five young children. She is from one of the towns in the department of Chinandega, located in the western area of the country. She owns and manages a grocery store located in her home, where she offeres all sorts of basic consumer goods like rice, beans, sugar, oil, soaps, detergents, sodas, sweets, and other items. She also sells clothing and cosmetics. She started her business one year ago and set it up with her own capital. She purchases the products she sells from distribution trucks, wholesale markets, etc. One of her dreams is to see her children become professionals, as well as to improve her home and give her children more safety. The purpose of this loan is to further stock her grocery store because she is seeing an increase in her customers' demand, and this is a way for her business to gradually generate more income and, in turn, financial stability.

loans.use: to buy household products like rice, sugar, beans, detergent, frozen foods, and other items.

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtsetseg, 39 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. She and her elder son have been working as a janitor and a welder, respectively, at a cement factory since 2010. Her husband has the  position of operator at a mining company. 

She is requesting a loan of MNT 2,000,000 to pay her daughter's tuition fees, as her family currently has no cash available. Her daughter studies at one of the best high schools in Darkhan, and Enkhtsetseg thinks a good education is the lifelong investment she can afford for her children.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice F. is 27 years old and she is married with two children, both of whom are schooling. She has been selling Fanta, Coca-Cola, Don Simon (orange juice), Calypso (drink mix) and foodstuff for 5 years now. She works from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit. 

This will be Eunice F's 5th loan from ID-Ghana and has used the previous loans to restock her bar. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profits from previous loans to help her husband cover household expenses. She will use this loan request amounting to GHS 1500 to buy 10 more crates of the various soft drinks and resell to customers in a maximum of two weeks.

Eunice F. is requesting the total loan amount of GHS 3800 together with three others who are into the selling of soft drinks and underwear. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy 10 crates of various soft drinks to resell to customers in a maximum of two weeks.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling used shoes in the Philippines.

Gina has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of used shoes to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Gina would like to save more money so she can afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Geysell Del Rosario

texts.es: Geysell habita en San Juan de la Concepcion, casada, ama de casa y ademas tiene un pequeños negocio, madre de una niña quien tiene 4 años de edad, su esposo la ayuda con los gastos del hogar y con la colegiatura de su hija, el trabaja como comerciante por cuanta propia, doña Geysell vende Especias como Canela, Manzanilla, Clavo de Olor, Linaza, Romero etc. entre los dos luchan dia a dia para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, este credito lo invertira en su negocio para que pueda crecer un poco mas y generar mayores ganancias. asi su familia podra salir adelante.
texts.en:
Geysell lives in San Juan de la Concepción.  She’s married and has a small business.  She’s mother of a little 4-year-old girl.  Her husband helps her with household expenses and with their daughter’s school tuition.  He works for himself as a merchant.

Geysell sells spices like cinnamon, chamomile, cloves, linseed, rosemary, etc. and both of them  strive daily to be able to improve their living conditions.  She will use this loan to invest in her business so that it will be able to grow a little and generate higher profits so her family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
KOTOTALA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Mariées avec moins trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités telles l’achat vente de condiments et les activités de restauration à l’image de KADIATOU qui est la personne  assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire. 
KADIATOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle dans la préparation et vente des plats alimentaire. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires (oignon, choux,) de la viande et des céréales.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Kototala is a group in the "Benkadi de Tiele" Association. The group is comprised of four women who know each other through family and neighbors. On average, they are 30 years old, married, and have fewer than three children.

They all have different businesses such as selling restaurant condiments and restoration activities. Kadiatou is the person seated at right. They live in large traditional families in Tiele, which is in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They have all had small businesses for a number of years and are well sought after in their businesses. In order to satisfy the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso's loan program two years ago. This is their third group loan. 

Kadiatou is the group president, is very well-known in Tiele, and excels in the preparation and sale of food dishes. 

She would like to use her loan to buy cooking ingredients (onions, cabbages), meat, and grains. She buys her supplies in Bamako and with local wholesalers. She sells her food items in Tiele at retail, for cash and credit, and to both men and women. 

She would like to earn a monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy cooking ingredients

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr: Les huit  femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont mariées à majorité monogames dans leurs ménages. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’djebougouni dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de la farine, du poisson et des condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Fatoumata (1ère   femme assise à  gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  bois de chauffe dans le village de Benzana et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter quelques chargements de charrettes  en bois de chauffe dans les villages environnants Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant  au marché et  à domicile à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 15.000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
The eight women of the Tiessiri group are mostly married and living in monogamous households. They have an average age of 39 years and 4 children each. They all live in the village of N'djebougouni in the Ségou region (the 4th administrative region of Mali) and came to know each other by means of neighbors, family, and their revenue-generating businesses in the village.

The women run small businesses in flour, fish, and spices. With the goal of expanding their businesses, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan. 

Fatoumata (the first woman pictured seated on the left) is a big seller of firewood in the village of Benzana and surrounding area. She plans to use her loan to purchase several cartloads of firewood in the villages around Ségou. She then resells them for cash in the market and from her home to a customer base mostly made up of women. 

Fatoumata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA with this loan, which she will use to care for her children and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
San Francisco es un grupo es un grupo que está trabajando y luchando por salir adelante. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las mujeres están con ingresos muy bajos, pero aun así se esfuerzan por salir adelante y mejorar sus vidas. 
Cinthia, una de las integrantes se dedica a la peluquería, tiene un pequeño establecimiento donde atiende a sus clientes, es una persona que entiende mucho de su trabajo y es por eso que le va muy bien. Comenta que sus clientas siempre están conformes con su trabajo y es por eso que le va muy bien. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos, como ser tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, y demás insumos para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes y así también mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
San Francisco is a group of women who are working and striving to make progress in life. They are doing the elimination of poverty survey, in which 3 of the women have very low incomes, but even so they are working hard to make progress and improve their lives.

Cinthia, one of the members, works as a hairdresser. She has a small premises where she looks after her clients. She knows a lot about her work and so it is going very well for her. She says her clients are always happy with her work and that is why it is going well. 

Cinthia is asking for this loan to buy supplies, such as hair colour, shampoo, rinses and other items so she can continue to provide a good service to her clients and so improve her income.

loans.use: to buy hair colour, shampoo, rinses and other supplies.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado San Francisco está en el 3º ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la zona de Ayolas Misiones, las señoras tienen su actividad comercial y su intención es incorporar nuevas actividades e incrementar las que ya tienen en marcha.
La Sra. Isidora es parte de este grupo, es una mujer muy responsable, que trabaja duro por salir adelante y poder aprender, comenta que ella ayuda mucho en su casa por medio de su trabajo y es por eso que se esta esforzando mucho. Ella vende bebidas, y comenta que tiene buena venta, en especial los fines de semana. Quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, es por eso que solicita de esta préstamo, para poder invertirlo en la compra de gaseosas, vinos, cervezas y demás, y así seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The group called San Francisco is in its 3rd cycle of the program forming a committee of women from the area of Ayolas Misiones. These women have commercial activities, and their intention is to incorporate new activities and increase those they have already started.

Señora Isidora is part of this group, and is a very responsible woman that works hard to get ahead and to learn. She helps her household a lot through her work, and it is for this that she works so hard. She sells drinks, and affirms she has a good business, especially on the weekends. She would like to continue investing in her business, for which she is requesting this loan, to be able to purchase soda, wine, beer, and more, and thus continue working.

loans.use: to buy soda, wine, beer, and more.

loans.name: Maria Candida Virginia

texts.es: Doña Maria es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos ellos estudian actualmente, hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, etc. con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ahora ella quiere hacer una mejora en su vivienda pero con lo que gana de sus ventas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón es que esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales laminas, clavos, madera, pago de mano de obra  para la construcción de una champa de lamina para poner su negocio y así ella su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
María’s a responsible, very hardworking person living in her own house with her life companion and their two children who are attending school at present.  She’s sold used clothes, perfume, cream, deodorant, etc. for several years earning income to cover some of her household expenses.  

Now, she’d like to do some home improvements but what she earns from her sales isn’t enough to do so which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy building supplies like metal sheeting, nails, lumber and to pay labor costs to build a metal shed to install her business in so she and her family can live more comfortably and more safely.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: Doña Maria de 51 años de edad es una persona  amable, responsable y trabajadora, vive en casa alquilada con su hijo quien estudia actualmente, hace 19 años posee su salón de belleza ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, tintes y ganchos para el cabello, shampoo, etc. para seguir con su negocio con esto espera brindarle a su familia una  mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 51, is a kind, responsible, hardworking person living in a rented house with her son who attends school at present.  She’s owned a beauty salon for 10 years located at home and uses what she earns from the business to pay some of her household expenses.  

María’s asking for a loan to buy more products like creams, dyes, bobby pins, shampoo, etc. for her beauty salon to continue in business hoping thus to provide her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr: Les sept  femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont mariées à majorité monogames dans leurs ménages. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Benzana dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de bois .Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2eme cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Djeneba (1ère femme assise à  gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  bois de chauffe   dans le village de Benzana et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité suffisante de bois de chauffe auprès des paysans des environs de  Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant au marché et à domicile à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Djeneba espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 20.000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Tiessiri group are mostly married women in monogamous households. They have an average age of 33 years and 5 children each. They all live in the village of Benzana in the region of Ségou (the 4th administrative region of Mali) and came to know each other through neighbors, family, and their revenue-generating businesses in the village.

The women are in the firewood business. With the goal of increasing their business capital, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle. 

Djeneba (the first woman seated on the left in the photo) is a big seller of firewood in the village of Benzana and surrounding area. She plans to use her loan to buy enough firewood from the farmers around Ségou. She then resells this for cash at the market and from her home to a customer base made up mostly of women. 

Djeneba hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA with this loan, which will be used to provide for her children's needs and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase firewood

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena. She previously obtained a PHP 10,000 loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 15,000 loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials for her tailoring. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rowena hopes that her business will continue to flourish, and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  There she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed for tailoring.

loans.name: Sopriana

texts.en:
Sopriana is 51 years old and from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four children, ages 13-21. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells chips, canned goods, toiletries and seasoning.

Sopriana is asking for a loan to buy rice, soft drinks, candies and chips.

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store with a variety of merchandise that her customers can choose from, so she can maximize her profit. She dreams of seeing her children having a proper education.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, candies and chips.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.fr: Elvie est un homme de 34 ans, marié et père d'un enfant. elle possède un chariot de crêperie (vente de crêpes) dans un quartier de la ville depuis deux ans. désireux de satisfaire sa clientèle et améliorer la qualité de ses crêpes, il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer ses matières premières (farine, huile, lait, œufs, sucre, levure, confiture) afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et son profit. les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'agrandir son activité (d'autres point de vente) et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Elvie is 34 years old.  He is married and the father of one child.  He owns a cart which he uses to make and sell crêpes .  He has been involved in this activity for the past two years and works in the city.
  
Eager to satisfy the needs of his customers and to improve the quality of his crêpes, he is taking this loan to increase his stock of ingredients (flour, oil, milk, eggs, sugar, baking powder and jam), in order to boost his turnover and profits.  

Elvie will use his profits to meet the needs of his family and increase his activity (he's thinking of opening other selling outlets).

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make "crêpes"

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Unidas” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su sacrificio, viven en una zona bastante rural, y aun en desarrollo, donde todas quieren que su barrio vaya creciendo para dar una mayor seguridad a sus hijos.
Una de las integrantes es Fatima, quien por medio de la cría de animales de corral lucha para dar a su familia lo que necesitan, su trabajo es bastante sacrificado, pero es la única forma que ella tiene de poder ayudarles. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en balanceados para sus animales, ya que quiere tener un buen stock y así seguir trabajando y luchando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está teniendo para mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The committee named “Unidas” (United Women) was formed by several neighbors from the city of Santaní.  All of the committee members have their own business activities so that they can help their families through their sacrifice.  They live in a fairly rural area that is still under development.  All of them want their neighborhood to grow so that their children can experience more security.  

One of the members is Fatima.  She raises farm animals so that she can provide her family what they need.  Her job requires sacrifice, but is this is the only way for her to provide for her family.  Fatima is requesting a loan so that she can invest in balanced feed for her animals since she wants to have good stock.  This will enable her to continue working and striving just as she has done before.  Fatima is grateful for the opportunity she has to improve her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El progreso es un grupo de Ciudad del Este, está en su  3er ciclo  del programa de comité donde ellas a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo empiezan a mejorar y crecer.
Una persona digna de destacar es Dominga, quien es muy buena haciendo comestibles, es muy hábil, ya que tiene una muy buena clientela y es eso lo que la está ayudando a poder crecer. Por medio de su trabajo su familia ha podido tener lo que necesitan y que no les falte nada, Ella es muy sacrificada y emprendedora.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus alimentos, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos y demás y así seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace, y a su vez mejorar su encomia.
texts.en:
El Progreso is a group in the city of Este. The members are in their third bank cycle and are, through their effort and work, beginning to improve and grow. One person who deserves to be highlighted is Dominga who makes very good food. She is very skilled and has a good customer base. This is what is helping her to grow. Through her work her family has been able to have what they need and they do not lack anything. She is very self-sacrificing and enterprising.

She is applying for this loan in order to purchase supplies, such as meat, vegetables, condiments and other items so that she can continue making her food. Thus she can continue delighting her customers with her delicacies and at the same time improve her finances.

loans.use: to purchase food such as meat, vegetables, condiments and other items.

loans.name: Mme Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado M.M.E está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde tres de ellas están con ingresos muy bajos, es decir que necesitan trabajar más para poder seguir creciendo.
Candida es una de las integrantes, quien por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella día a día se esfuerza más y mas para poder crecer. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de toda clase y de esa forma lucha y quiere mejorar. Es una persona con grandes metas y sueños.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos de variadas marcas, para que de esa forma siga invirtiendo en su emprendimiento y vaya mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group, called M.M.E is in its third cycle of the Women Committee program. The members took the poverty elimination survey and three were found to have a very low income, which means they need to work more in order to continue growing.

Candida is one of the members. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has managed to get ahead and help her family. She works harder every day to grow more. She sells all kinds of cosmetic products, fighting to improve. She is a person that has ambitious goals and dreams.

Candida is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics from different brands to continue investing in her entrepreneurial project and improving her income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité  se dedican a variadas actividades. Este grupo se encuentra en su 9to ciclo del programa de comité en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las integrantes en la asistencia en las capacitaciones.
Alejandra, una de las integrantes, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, y comenta que gracias a sus buenos productos ya se hizo de muy buena clientela, que siempre recibe pedidos y está tratando de cumplir siempre con ellos y de esa forma tener el dinero suficiente para ayudar a su familia.
Hoy ella pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos de buenas marcas, para poder seguir con sus ventas, cumplir con sus clientes y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The members of this committee engage in various activities.  This group is in its ninth loan cycle with the committee program, which has highlighted the members’ sense of responsibility and their desire to make progress.  Each of the members attends training seminars.  

Alejandra is one of the members who sells cosmetics.  She says that thanks to the good products she offers, she has been able to build up a very good clientele.  She always receives orders and tries to fulfill them.  This enables her to have sufficient income to help her family.  

Today Alejandra is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of cosmetics that are of good brands.  This will allow her to continue her sales, satisfy her customers, and help her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Pora está en su ciclo número 25 del programa de comité, donde todas y cada una de ellas quiere poder salir adelante y lo demuestran con la unión y el trabajo duro que hacen. Gracias a que se están esforzando, cada vez van mejorando mas en lo que cada una hace. Ellas además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Jacinta, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir mejorando su situación, a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa.  Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que realiza trabajos modista, comenta que está esforzándose por salir adelante, e ir mejorando en su trabajo, ella lucha y se está esforzando bastante.
La Sra. Jacinta solicita de este crédito para la compra de  insumos para surtir su negocio, como ser telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group, called Kuña Pora, is in its 25th loan of the committee programme, where each and every one of these women want to get ahead and demonstrate that with the union and the hard work they do. Because they are growing stronger, they are each improving in what they do. They are also carrying out an poverty survey in order to understand each member's situation.

One of the group's members is Señora Jacinta, who in her last survey was at poverty level 3, which means that her situation is improving through effort and continual work and applying the vital habits of a successful woman. As for the work she does, she is a dressmaker. She says that she is getting stronger and getting ahead and improving in her work. She is fighting and making progress. Señora Jacinta is asking for this loan to buy supplies to expand her business, such as fabric, threads, glue, buttons etc. which will help her to consolidate her business plan and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, buttons etc.

loans.name: San Cayetano 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano 2” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Itacurubi del Rosario. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades eminentemente rurales. Ellas son de lugares lejanos de difícil acceso y que están luchando por salir adelante.
Estela es la presidenta de este grupo, ella se dedica a una actividad rural, la que es la cría de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, patos, cerdos y demás. Es una persona muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante e ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados, y de esa forma poder seguir con la cría de sus animales y luchar por su familia.
texts.en:
The “San Cayetano 2” communal bank was formed as a group from various neighbors in the city of Itacurubi del Rosario. All the members of the group are involved in rural activities. They are from a place with poor access and they struggle to get ahead. 

Estela is the president of the group. She raises farm animals such as chickens, ducks, pigs etc. She is a fighter who wants to get ahead and improve the life of her family. She is requesting this loan to invest it in buying balanced feed and in this way be able to continue raising animals and fighting for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for animals.

loans.name: Grupo Unido San Ramon Group

texts.es:
Grupo Unido San Ramon está en su Segundo ciclo, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 de las 17 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy escasos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Cirila, quien según su encuesta esta en el nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero ella sigue luchando para poder mejorar su vida y sus ingresos. Ella es manicurista, y comenta que  su trabajo lo realiza a domicilio. Sus clientas siempre están conformes con el trabajo que ella hace, y gracias a eso esta saliendo adelante.
Con su crédito quiere comprar esmaltes para abaratar los costos y así seguir trabajando.  Ellas están agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, ya que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Ramon" is in its second loan cycle.  The members have participated in a poverty elimination survey and four of the 17 women are considered to be below the red line, meaning they have very scarce incomes.

One of the members is Cirila who is at level one on the survey, showing a very low income.  But she continues to struggle to improve her life and income.  She is a manicurist and works from home.  Her clients are happy with her work and that is why she is able to get ahead.

The loan will be used to buy nail polish to reduce costs and allow Cirila to continue working.  She is grateful for this opportunity because it will be of much help to her.

loans.use: To buy nail polish for manicures.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Oñondivepa está empezando a trabajar junto, está muy esperanzado en el programa de comité de mujeres, ya que les dará una oportunidad de crecer. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una. 
Delia es parte de este grupo, y ella vende prendas de toda clase, por medio del programa quiere ir mejorando para poder darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora. Agradece por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo, que les será de mucha ayuda.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todo tipo, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y luchando por su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Oñondivepa" has started work through the women's program with the hope of giving everyone an opportunity to grow.  The members are taking the poverty elimination survey to determine the situation each one is in.

Delia is a member of the group and she sells all kinds of clothing.  Through the program she wants to improve her situation so she can give her family a better lifestyle.  She is a hard-working entrepreneur and grateful for this opportunity which will be very helpful for her.

She is requesting a loan to buy all kinds of clothing so she can continue working and struggling for her family.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es estudiante de la carrera de administración de empresas, cuenta además que tiene su propio negocio en el que trabaja duro todos los días.
Comenta que su sueño es poder recibirse y de esa forma poder aplicar todo lo que aprendió en su negocio y así poder manejarlo.
El solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma estar cerca de su sueño. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Diego is from the city of Carapeguá and he studies business administration.  He also runs his own business where he works every day.

His dream is to graduate so he can apply all he knows about business management.  He is requesting a loan to pay for higher education costs so he can strive toward his goal.  He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña guapa quiere decir mujer laboriosa, que se esfuerza, y eso es lo que son estas mujeres de comité, que se unieron para trabajar y salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos bajos, quienes deben seguir luchando por salir adelante para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de ellas es la señora Pablina, quien se dedica a la venta de carbón, ella trabaja desde muy tempranas horas, y cuenta que su venta esta buena, ya que el carbón es mas barato al gas la gente lo compra mucho. Por medio de su negocio tiene los ingresos que su familia necesita, y por medio de su trabajo los ayuda.
Hoy pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carbón, ya que es su producto de trabajo y quiere seguir haciéndolo.
texts.en:
Kuña Guapa signifies hardworking, determined women.  This describes the members of this group, who came together to work and get ahead.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey.  Four group members are below the poverty line (meaning that they have low income).  They have to continue to struggle to grow and progress.

Pablina is one of the group members.  She works selling charcoal starting very early in the morning.  She says that her sales are good, since people buy more charcoal than gas due to it being less expensive.  Through her business, she is able to get the income that her family needs.  Through her work, she helps them.

Today, she is asking for this loan so she can buy charcoal, since it is the good that she sells and she wants to continue to do it.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married to a farmer from Dinas, Sinacaban, in Misamis Occidental. Arlene and her two children help her husband on their farm, cultivating coconuts to make a living. She also plants bananas and corn as under-cropping. Her previous loans, which she used to purchase farm inputs, were successfully repaid. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to cover the costs of plowing and weeding her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her farm.

loans.use: to cover the costs of plowing and weeding her farm.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es: Juan Angel mayor de edad, padre soltero con cinco hijos aún bajo su responsabilidad,  vive el en departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país, es propietario de un negocio en el que presta los servicio de molino, venta de cerdos, leña, maíz, plástico el inicio su negocio primeramente con la venta de leña al por mayor, a raíz de eso comenzó a vender los antes mencionados, ya tiene 18 años de tener este negocio, uno de sus sueños es poder tener mejores ingresos para lograr una estabilidad económica con la que pueda mantener a su familia, él solicita crédito para la capital de trabajo en la compra de maíz, cerdos, productos plásticos y así  invertir en sus negocios pues el espera poder tener mejores ingresos en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en: Juan Ángel is an adult single father responsible for five children.  He lives in Chinandega Department in the west of the country.  He owns a business providing milling services and sells pigs, firewood, corn and plastic ware.  He started the business originally selling firewood at wholesale and from that started selling the other mentioned things.  He’s been in business 18 years.  One of his dreams is to earn higher income to have better economic stability to support his family.  He requests the loan as working capital to buy corn, pigs, plastic items thus investing in his businesses because he hopes to earn higher income in the not too distant future.

loans.use: to buy corn, pigs, plastic ware and firewood, among others.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Sonia de 41 años de edad es una persona honesta y trabajadora, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, hace varios años se dedica al negocio de tortillas, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Sonia solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio como maíz por mayor y cal,  con esto espera brindarle a su familia una  mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sonia, 41, is an honest, hardworking woman living with her husband and three children in her own house.  She’s been in the tortilla business for several years and uses what she earns from her business to pay some of her household expenses.  Sonia’s asking for a loan to buy ingredients like corn at wholesale and lime powder for the business.  With this she’ll provide better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and lime powder.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. Her previous loan was a big help in her business, as she was able to buy the materials that she needed in her tailoring. Her income from the loan assisted in their everyday expenses at home. She is already a widow, and she works hard to provide for her everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda dreams to have more customers and hopes for good health for her and her family. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ecole Faraja Group

texts.fr: Le client Kadosi est leader du collectif d’affaire des enseignants  de « l’école Faraja», âgé de 49 ans et père de 5 enfants qui étudient tous. Son épouse est aussi une enseignante dans une école primaire. Le client vit de son travail et il est confortable de métier. Le nouveau prêt va lui servir dans son projet d’habitat (construction).  Ainsi, il souhaite renouveler son prêt prochainement et lancer le projet de commerce. Au finish, il remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux enseignants.
texts.en: The client, Kadosi, is the leader of the business collective of teachers from the Faraja School. He is 49 years old and the father of five children, all of whom attend school. His wife is also an elementary school teacher. The client makes a living from his work and is comfortable with his profession. The new loan will help him with the construction of his home. Thus, he wishes to renew his loan afterwards to launch a business project. In conclusion, he thanks Hekima for supporting teachers with their microcredit loans.

loans.use: to help construct his home

loans.name: Ileana

texts.es:
Doña Ileana es jefa de familia,vive con sus dos hijas menores.
Ella es manicurista,y requiere en este momento de apoyo económico para poderse tratar un problema muy serio de salud que tiene en su dentadura. Para no disminuir su capital de trabajo, ella solicita en la fundación un crédito, que le permitirá cubrir todos los gastos de este tratamiento .
Para ella es muy importante el poder hacerselo, ya que mejorará su apariencia fisíca, su salud y le dará seguridad y confianza.
La clienta tiene varios años de ofrecer su servicio de manicure en su comunidad,activida con la cual genera los ingresos económicos mes a mes , con ellos  atiende todas las necesidades de su familia, reinvierte y paga sus obligaciones crediticias.
Ella tiene como meta ampliar su negocio, mejorar laeconomía familiar y lograr crecimiento como persona y como empresaria.
texts.en: Ileana is the head of her household. She lives with her two daughters who are under the age of eighteen. She is a manicurist, and right now she needs economic support to be able to treat a very serious health problem in her teeth. In order to not decrease her working capital, she is applying for a loan from the foundation, which will allow her to cover all the costs of this treatment. It is very important for her to be able to do it, since it will improve her physical appearance and her health, and it will give her security and confidence. She has been offering her manicure services in the community for several years, and this is an activity with which she earns an income month to month. With this income, she meets all of her family's needs, she reinvests, and she pays her loan obligations. Her goal is to expand her business, improve her household economy, and grow as a person and a businesswoman.

loans.use: to undergo a dental procedure

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
Ma. Ana is forty, married and has three children, two of whom are in school. For the past five years she has worked hard buying and selling used shoes.

Ma. Ana is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of used shoes to sell. Her ambition is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Institut Faraja Group

texts.fr: Le client Mihio est leader du collectif d’affaire des enseignants de « Institut Faraja», jeune enseignant, célibataire, âgé de 28 ans. Le client vit de son travail et il est confortable avec son métier, bien que son salaire ne soit pas décent, il vient fraichement de l’université. Il est encore jeune dans la carrière. Le nouveau prêt va lui servir dans son projet d’habitat et d’acheter un nouvel équipement de sa maison (chaises, armoire, appareils Télévision, lecteur, appareils électroménagers, etc.). Ainsi, il souhaite renouveler son prêt prochainement pour acheter une parcelle.  Au finish, il remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux enseignants.
texts.en: Mihio is the leader of the teachers' business cooperative of the Faraja institute. He is a young teacher aged 28 and single. He earns his living from his job and his profession is comfortable although his salary is inadequate. He is just out of university. He is still new to his career. The new loan will help him in his project of setting up his lodgings and to buy new items for his home (chairs, wardrobe, televisions, player, electric household appliances, etc.) Subsequently he wishes to renew his loan to purchase a plot of land. Finally, he is very grateful to Hekima for their micro credit support to teachers.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for his home (chairs, wardrobe, televisions, player, electric household appliances, etc.)

loans.name: Rafikimwema Group

texts.fr:
Liliane fait partie du groupe  Rafikimwema  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 35 ans et mariée à Célestin, un coiffeur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 4 à 14 ans, tous étudient.

Elle vend le service de charge batteries depuis 3 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capitale et acheter une machine à charger et six tablettes sur lesquelles la machine et les batteries seront posées. 

Dans les années à venir, elle  voudrait avoir  une  propre place pour son travail et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Liliane is a member of the Rafikimwema group and she lives in Bujumbura.  She is 35 years old and married to Célestin, who works as a hairdresser. Liliane and  Célestin have four children between the ages of 4 and 14.  All their children are in school.

Liliane has been providing battery recharge services for three years.

This is her fifth loan with Turame.  With this loan, financed by Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy machine load and six tablets on which the machine and the batteries will be placed. This will make her work easier and, in turn, will allow her to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to have her own workspace and continue to see her children go to school.

loans.use: to buy battery-charging equipment (charger and six cables)

loans.name: Jhon Jaime

texts.es: John, con 55 años de edad, es casado y padre de 3 hijos. Desde que tenía 18 años de edad, conoció la actividad comercial, pues le ayudaba a su padrino en una carnicería, allí aprendió gran parte de lo que hoy en día sabe. Gracias a ello, actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes y carnicería, que montó desde hace 6 años; trabaja solo todos los días de 7:00 am a 6:00 pm, de esta manera ha generado los recursos económicos necesarios para sacar adelante a sus hijos y su esposa.
